story:
My name is Dave Bayford.

I write under the name M.D. Dragon. I am owner and operator of Boaz Jachin Publishing. This campaign is to help get my company up and running in a proper and professional capacity. By donating to this you will help me reach this goal. 

This campaign will benificial to to both myself and the comunity I reside in.

I am in need of $4000 to help me get the office space needed and to get the first book in print, both in e-book and softcover format. I am offering everyone who helps in this campaign a free e-book copy of the book and a 50% discount on the softcover at my book launch. The copy of the book if purchased will be autographed as well. There will be a limited number of books available in the first printing, only 200 will be printed, so this makes the first print autographed that much more special. Any funds raised if I don't reach my goal within the 60 days will be going towards printing costs and or office space leasing depending on the amount that does get raised. 

Your contribution will help me to get this company into the professional light and to help me leave behind something for my family.

In doing this I am also hoping that I can give back to the community that I have called home for the past 26 years. I have over the past 20 years been involved in youth organizations such as Youth Bowling Counsel, Umpire for Pee Wee League, former Vice-President Navy League for Triumph Sea Cadets, Chair school counsel and head of the nutrition program at Memorial city school. All of which are located in the Crown Point community in Hamilton Ontario.

All fundraisers come with trials and tribulations.

Using the money will help to establish the company in a very competitive market. Most publishing companies prefer to stick within specific genres. This company will be open to all genres. This gives all authors a chance to be published under one label instead of trying to find a publisher that only deals in the genre that they write in. It also helps them to find a company that is not a vanity label. This means that my company will not be focused only on our output every year but on the quality of writing by the authors that sign with us.

Every little bit helps.

Even if you are unable to help monetarily at this time, spreading the word about this campaign helps as well. Spread the word to all your friends and family and anyone else who would be interested in helping me in seeing my goal of establishing myself in this market and being a welcoming company to new Canadian authors. This doesn't just affect me but others in this industry as well.

I want to thank you in advance for all your help and baring with my campaign details to the end. 

 

M.D. Dragon

Author / Publisher

story:
As you will have noticed unlike other campaigns I do not have a video for this campaign. The fact is that their is nothing much to put into a video that I cannot tell you here without revealing my true identity.

To get a free copy of chapter one from The Devil's Son, then click here.

Short Summary

Having spent the first decade of my life being physically assaulted and the last eight years being mentally manipulated into believing it was acceptable to be punched, kicked and beaten for little or no reason I have chosen to speak out. My physical abuse is now over but the scars are still there and I live with one former abuser who still mentally tortures me!

My campaign is here to change it! I want to make enough money to leave my home and pursue the dreams and ambitions that I couldn't under their imprisonment. I want people to know my story in order to understand what the effects of being abused are. It is not all sad. A big part of the book is about the things that helped me survive it all. It highlights the rare and amazing opportunities I got to do while living in France and Romania. I’m selling the story so far to make sure I can go further!

I have lived through heaven and hell and all I want to do is move on. With your help that is what I can do. I can launch my story to the world through this book and help more people who are suffering abuse. I also need this money to move away from the house I share with my spoiled; overly loved sister and former abusing mother, who has worked to destroy my every shr

ed of success as detailed in the book. You're changing my life for the better!

What We Need & What You Get

I need to make at least $5,000 to leave my current home and set myself up in a different place. It’s the bare minimum that I will need to start something new.

Two thirds of the income will go towards printing and delivering the book. An investment in a new cover for the book is being planned. The cost of a good artist rendition for the book cover will be roughly $1,000. This should bring the book to a standard suitable for publishing via mainstream routes in both printed and ebook formats. 

Below is a donut chart outlining where the money you are giving to this campaign is going.

As you can see a large amount of the money is being spent on printing new books. These books are the ones being ordered on indiegogo. Any spare books will be sold offline or to our indiegogo InDemand contributors. An investment in the book cover will take a fifth of the income. The remaining income that is not take in Indiegogo and transaction fees will go towards my plans to leave my current home life and live somewhere free from the torment I am currently forced to live with.

The Impact

This campaign has two main impacts, one personal and one that is of a wider influence. You will be helping me to raise enough money to leave what is currently a miserable place to live. You will also be contributing to a larger change in peoples understanding of abuse. The book will give you all an insight into what it is like to have lived my life and why it is important to address abuse in society. You will helping people currently living with abuse, former victims of abuse and will also give the abusers an insight into the effects of their actions on their victims.

I have lived every moment depicted in this book. I know what it is like to be the recipient of constant physical and psychological abuse by the people trusted to protect me the most in this world. I want to let the world know what it is like to live in a destructive world with no one to trust and nothing but hope to keep you going.

Risks & Challenges

The obstacles I have before me are the deadlines I have set for completion of the book for release. I have set some short deadlines for publishing but they are very much achievable and given the current writing pace the book should be complete by the end of June. 

The artist would be hired at the end of the campaign and work on a short timeframe to complete the cover. Printing times will take two weeks before we can begin sending them out for national and international delivery. It is a tight set of deadlines but achievable and would allow prompt publication of the book.

FAQ's Answered by Mark

Why did you write the book?

I wrote this book as my own form of closure for what was a decade of physical abuse and has continued into another decade of verbal and mental abuse. It will serve as a warning to abusers. A message to those who abused me and a thank you to the many people who helped me. 

What do you plan to do with the funds you raise?

I hope to use the initial income funds to have the books produced and ready for publishing. It should only take a third of the income to from hardcopy book sales to make up the initial orders and an additional bit to have some artwork complete for the covers. After that I am looking to launch the book on the market and would use a portion of the funds raised as an investment in a wide scale release. 

The remaining profits that I make from this book will be used to escape the house I currently live in. I still live with a former abuser and want to create a better life for myself as well as a career that I can enjoy. Depending on the money I have I would like to get my pilot's licences, private, commercial and instrument ratings.

What was your inspiration for the book?

Quite simply James Rhodes. Having heard his story only a few weeks ago and his ambition to face his abusers by writing about his experiences I wondered if it could bring me some final closure and spread the word about what happens when you are in my situation. A situation where you cannot trust anyone around you, neither of your parents and no real friends. It is a lonely place to be and you fear to bring others into it because you know you'll end up hurting them.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean that you can't help: 

  • Following us and retweeting on Twitter will help spread the word about the book. 
  • A like and share of Facebook will also help to spread the word online.
  • You may want to email the link to a friend which can also be done at the top of this page.

To those of you reading and supporting my campaign.
Thank You,
Mark Armstrong

What We Need & What You Get
I need to
make at least $5,000 to leave my current home and set myself up in a different
place. It’s the bare minimum that I will need to start something new.
Two thirds of the income will go towards printing and delivering the book. An investment in a new cover for the book is being planned. The cost of a good artist rendition for the book cover will be roughly $1,000. This should bring the book to a standard suitable for publishing via mainstream routes in both printed and ebook formats. Below is a donut chart outlining where the money you are giving to this campaign is going.As you can see a large amount of the money is being spent on printing new books. These books are the ones being ordered on indiegogo. Any spare books will be sold offline or to our indiegogo InDemand contributors. An investment in the book cover will take a fifth of the income. The remaining income that is not take in Indiegogo and transaction fees will go towards my plans to leave my current home life and live somewhere free from the torment I am currently forced to live with.  
The Impact
 This campaign has two main impacts, one personal and one that is of a wider influence. You will be helping me to raise enough money to leave what is currently a miserable place to live. You will also be contributing to a larger change in peoples understanding of abuse. The book will give you all an insight into what it is like to have lived my life and why it is important to address abuse in society. You will helping people currently living with abuse, former victims of abuse and will also give the abusers an insight into the effects of their actions on their victims.
I have lived every moment depicted in this book. I know what it is like to be the recipient of constant physical and psychological abuse by the people trusted to protect me the most in this world. I want to let the world know what it is like to live in a destructive world with no one to trust and nothing but hope to keep you going.
    Risks & Challenges The obstacles I have before me are the deadlines I have set for completion of the book for release. I have set some short deadlines for publishing but they are very much achievable and given the current writing pace the book should be complete by the end of June. 

The
artist would be hired at the end of the campaign and work on a short timeframe
to complete the cover. Printing
times will take two weeks before we can begin sending them out for national and international delivery. It is a tight set of deadlines but achievable and would allow prompt publication of the book.
FAQ's Answered by MarkWhy did you write the book?I wrote this book as my own form of closure for what was a decade of physical abuse and has continued into another decade of verbal and mental abuse. It will serve as a warning to abusers. A message to those who abused me and a thank you to the many people who helped me. What do you plan to do with the funds you raise?I hope to use the initial income funds to have the books produced and ready for publishing. It should only take a third of the income to from hardcopy book sales to make up the initial orders and an additional bit to have some artwork complete for the covers. After that I am looking to launch the book on the market and would use a portion of the funds raised as an investment in a wide scale release. The remaining profits that I make from this book will be used to escape the house I currently live in. I still live with a former abuser and want to create a better life for myself as well as a career that I can enjoy. Depending on the money I have I would like to get my pilot's licences, private, commercial and instrument ratings.What was your inspiration for the book?Quite simply James Rhodes. Having heard his story only a few weeks ago and his ambition to face his abusers by writing about his experiences I wondered if it could bring me some final closure and spread the word about what happens when you are in my situation. A situation where you cannot trust anyone around you, neither of your parents and no real friends. It is a lonely place to be and you fear to bring others into it because you know you'll end up hurting them.Other Ways You Can HelpI understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean that you can't help: 
Following us and retweeting
     on Twitter will help spread the word about the book. 
A like and share of Facebook
     will also help to spread the word online.
You may
     want to email the link to a friend which can also
     be done at the top of this page.
To those of you reading and supporting my campaign.Thank You,Mark Armstrong

story:
I'm Stephanie Dube Dwilson, author of A Basket Full of Kittens, a children's book illustrated by A.J. Cosmo. Thanks for visiting my campaign! :-)  


My book is about a lonely kitten who goes on a quest for companionship. Along the way he must face many challenges and failures, and he even befriends a butterfly, before ultimately finding a human who wants to adopt him.


A Basket Full of Kittens teaches about the joys of animal adoption, which is why 10 percent of the sales will benefit The Cattery. (More info on that below.) To be honest, I think this will be the perfect book for anyone who loves reading with children and loves animals.

It is written for young children (target age 2-8) who like cats. Or whom you would want to like cats. It's based on my cat, Mufasa whom I adopted from an animal shelter with my husband Derek. Mufasa loves to be around people. This is a video of him:



Derek and I have done our research and found a great printer who has a reputation for making very high quality, glossy, hardcover books. These do not look and feel like self-published books. If we successfully fund, we will print at least 500 copies of A Basket Full of Kittens. It will be a beautiful hardcover 8" x 10" book with 42 pages. 

Our plan would also allow us to give 10% of total sales (not profit, sales) to The Cattery, a great charity in my hometown of Corpus Christi, Texas, which is reinventing the animal shelter in a fun and exciting way.

The illustration, design, and writing of A Basket Full of Kittens is complete. All that's left is to format the book for print and pay for a number of expenses. The first edition should take about 9 weeks to process and print once the order is in. 

We are using the "fixed funding" option. That just means that if we don't reach our goal, you'll get your money back. But you won't get a book. Or a signed note from Mufasa. And the book won't get printed. :( That would be very sad, so let's make sure that doesn't happen, OK?

I'd love to print more than 500 copies of the book and make this into a full-blown series. My ultimate goal is to teach children how to interact with cats. Our next book would introduce a new child to Mufasa the Cat, showing him the best ways to pick up a cat, pet a cat, etc. to avoid being scratched. Each book in the series would also further the goal of encouraging pet adoptions!

Honestly, writing children's literature would be my dream job, and this Indiegogo being successful would be a huge step in the right direction for me. Little kids are everywhere. You might have them. They may belong to relatives or close friends or co-workers. Consider giving them this politically neutral book, which will be easy to ready for even a very young reader. The emphasis is on a cat who likes people, trying to find people to be with. Cause hey, that's cute and you know it. ;) 

In addition to buying a perk, you can help by spreading the word. We need to get TONS of people talking about A Basket Full of Kittens so this Indiegogo campaign will go viral. We've got to get the press's attention! You can use the sharing links that Indiegogo provides on this page. 


Ten percent of the sales in this Indiegogo campaign (yes, that's SALES, not just profits) will be given to The Cattery, a very unique and amazing cat shelter in Corpus Christi, Texas.

The Cattery is a no-kill, cage-free shelter. Here, cats live and play together in a loving environment while they wait for their forever (or "furever") home. I've been to The Cattery many times and it's soooo nice. They are very careful to vet adopters and make sure the cats and kittens will be well taken care of in their new lives.

Want a little more convincing? Check out this video of how cats live while "in-between homes" at The Cattery:

story:
About California is Not For Sale 

Have you heard the joke about politicians wearing the logos of their sponsors like Nascar drivers? Well, we are making that a law in California! 

The California is Not For Sale initiative will require politicians to wear the logos of their top ten corporate donors anytime they present a bill on the assembly floor. 

We need YOUR help to make this happen! We need to collect 365,000 signatures by April 26th to make it on the ballot and we only have 150,000 so far. 

All funds raised will be used for paid signature gatherers and to help raise awareness around this cause. 

You can read the official Title and Summary here: 

https://www.oag.ca.gov/system/files/initiatives/pdfs/Title%20and%20Summary%20%2815-0097%29.pdf

Mashable Article: 

http://mashable.com/2016/02/28/california-nasca...

Washington Times: 

http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2015/nov/26/john-cox-california-entrepreneur-proposes-donor-lo/?page=all

The Problem

Big money in politics has gone too far. Average citizens don’t have a voice and it’s time that changes. By highlighting big money in politics, we can raise awareness around this issue and give citizens the voice they deserve.

Our Mission

We’re sick and tired of watching our state fall apart. Now is the time to do something about it. We’re on a mission to end political corruption and it all starts here.

The Solution

Our bill will require California legislators to display the logos of their top ten donors when they speak on the Assembly Floor. This level of transparency will expose conflicts of interest that exist between politicians and big money.

Saving democracy doesn’t come cheap. 

And no, the irony is not lost on us: to get money out of politics, we’re going to need to spend some ourselves.

You can donate money to help support the signatures gathering efforts (We pay around $2 per signature to our community team — this adds up fast!).

By making a donation, you are playing a crucial role in restoring political equality, genuine representation, and public participation in California politics. If you’re passionate about other issues (environmental protection, education, civil rights, etc.), know that a donation to the “California is Not For Sale” is also a tangible step towards making your voice heard on the issues that you care about most.

No amount is too small, so feel free to give as your budget allows. We salute you for your patriotism, and thank you warmly for your generosity.

We need your help!

We are investing over $1,000,000 to make this happen but what we really need is the community’s support to make this happen.

Are you tired of feeling like politicians have all the power?

LET’S TAKE THE POWER BACK.

Here are some perks to choose from:

Here are a few more ways you can help:

SIGN: If you are in California and a registered voter, you can sign our petition (We need 365,000 of them to make it happen). To do this, you can download the 1 page petition, sign it then send it to us! It will only take 2 minutes of your time!

VOLUNTEER: If you are in California, you can volunteer to help us collect signatures. We are up against BIG unions and corporations who will fight this, we need your help to get the 365,000 signatures needed to get on the ballot!

SPREAD THE WORD: If you aren’t in California, you can post it on your social media channels, email it to your friends and tell everyone you meet. This isn’t just about ending political corruption in California, this s about ending political corruption across the world.


Disclaimer: Funding for this initiative is paid for by CNFS Chairman, John Cox.

story:
About Me!

My name is Ceara Comeau and I am a twenty-two year old college senior majoring in Public Relations/Advertising. For the last ten years I have been writing science fiction/mystery books and self-publishing them.  It wasn't until just a few months ago that I realized I needed to go back and redo a series that I began when I was twelve. It had potential, but I knew I could do better.  My series is called "The Amber Oak Series".  I have just finished writing my first book of this new series (out of eight) called "A New Beginning".

This book is about a tragic death, murderous creatures, and strange family secrets. These are but a few things that enter Amber Oak's seemingly normal life. However, the young fifteen year old girl is about to find out that nothing is as it seems.

I am trying to get out of self-publishing and into the traditional form. That is what this campaign is all about.  I am trying to raise money for the next step of this awesome journey! 

What I Need & What You Get

In order to accomplish this dream, I need a total of $6,500. 

This is where the money will go:

    Editing:  $1,400

    I have sent my manuscript to a very reputable editing agency who is interested in my story.  Included in this price they quoted is the cost of a letter that I will get from them which I can send to literary agents.

    Cover Art & Interior Formatting:  $1,450

    This is a full package deal from a book design agency that has made several book covers which have won awards.

    IndieGoGo’s 5% Fee:  $325

    Paypal’s 2.9% Fee:   $180

    Perks: $1,645

    Ordering and mailing copies of the book to contributors.

    Travel: $1,500

    This would be for travel and hotel expenses if I need to meet with agents.  I anticipate that I will be going to NY where many of the sci-fi agents are. Anything left from this amount would go towards additional marketing costs, book signings and further promotion of my book once published.


"What do I get out of this?" Glad you asked! There are five perks that you might like. The first perk is for those who would like to donate something to the campaign, but are not ready for an exclusive perk. For the second perk, you will get an  eBook version of this new book. If that doesn't peak your interest, then with the third perk you will get a hard copy of the book. The fourth perk is a really great deal, not only will you get a hard copy of the book, but it will come autographed and with a personal thank you note. The final perk gets even better! It comes with everything; an eBook version, an autographed copy of the book as well as a personal thank you note, and I will also publicly thank  you on my Facebook for your support!

What Could This Impact?

My books may be science fiction, but they are so much more than just that. I've written the characters in such a way where you can relate to them in some way or another. I want to be an encouragement to other writers and show them that dreams really can come true. I know that sounds cliche, but with determination, perseverance, and a dash of courage anything is possible. 


What's The Risk?

As with any new adventure, there are always going to be some sort of risks involved. In this case, there are two.

  • Not all the money could be raised
  • There could be unexpected expenses

As for the first case, if I am not able to raise the amount I had hoped for, I won't give up. Instead, I'll start another campaign, at least I will have learned something from this one. For the second case, I may be fortunate enough to get all the money, however an expense could come up that wasn't expected. Providing the expense isn't too much, I would have to pay out of pocket. If it is too much, then I would need to do another fundraiser and would then have to put a stop in the publishing process. 


How Can You Help? 

If you are not able to give at this time the best way you can help me is by spreading the news! Word of mouth is the best way to get the news out there! Tell your friends, tweet it or post it on Facebook.  

If I go over my monetary goal, that is great! There are always unforeseen circumstances that could arise that the extra funds can go to. Plus, it can be used towards anything needed for publishing the remaining 7 books of the series!


Thank you for your support.  I couldn't do it without you!

story:
Why Arcoiris

As a communicator, i meet people in many different situations, and when we have to deal with little children the recurrent question is what i have do to get them quiet? There are no a single answer but what always works to me is take children seriously through fun games and activities. Thinking about that, Arcoiris was organized as a small collection of children's books to coloring, create new designs and learn easily.

Content of those book are guided by preschool stimulation rules, so kids and girls can better take advantage of them. Each activity have short instructions to daddies take part or guide children through the work.

Now comes the other side of the decision to be guided by preschool stimulation rules: distribute part of the print edition among children from low-income families. Preschool education provides children with the tools and basic concepts to face new learning in the future. However, preschool centers in Peru are often private and the material is expensive.

Arcoiris is not only a collection of books for children, but also a solidarity project that gives children in poverty the opportunity to obtain basic tools for their development.

What we need

The collection is almost ready, my partners in this adventure and I are working on the design and drawings before printing. Now is when we need your help to take the books to the printing press, the packaging and finally the distribution.
If we get more than we have planned, we can go faster with the distribution of books in communities within the country.

The proposal 

The two books are intended to stimulate communication skills, graphomotor skills and motor coordination in children, as well as to develop concentration and memory.
With that objective, mandalas, puzzles and identification games have been developed, which can be developed according to the creative perception of each child.

Our editorial proposal includes exercises that help children to express in a healthy way the stress and frustration that can be generated by the acquisition of new abilities. Thus, the little ones will learn to take control of their emotions.

Each book stimulates a group of skills: ABC is oriented to communication, graphomotor skills and motor coordination, while Mandalas reinforces concentration and memory, and at the same time introduces children to basic mathematics. This, however, does not prevent both books from finding points of mutual encounter and review.

Risks and challenges

The restless temperament of children and their great capacity for distraction contrasts dramatically with the stillness and tranquility of the pages of a book. Therefore, one of the main challenges in developing these books was to achieve a balance between homework and play, so that children stay entertained and learning is fun.

Ways to help

There are many ways to help us complete the launch of this mini-collection: supporting solidarity, buying the books in advance or promoting the campaign through friends and acquaintances who might be interested.

So that others know about this campaign do not forget to share it by clicking on the icons of social networks, choose yours and help us promote this beautiful adventure.

Thank you very much for being there and helping us in any way you can.

Pamela.
story_txt:
Why Arcoiris
As a communicator, i meet people in many different situations, and when we have to deal with little children the recurrent question is what i have do to get them quiet? There are no a single answer but what always works to me is take children seriously through fun games and activities. Thinking about that, Arcoiris was organized as a small collection of children's books to coloring, create new designs and learn easily.
Content of those book are guided by preschool stimulation rules, so kids and girls can better take advantage of them. Each activity have short instructions to daddies take part or guide children through the work.
Now comes the other side of the decision to be guided by preschool stimulation rules: distribute part of the print edition among children from low-income families. Preschool education provides children with the tools and basic concepts to face new learning in the future. However, preschool centers in Peru are often private and the material is expensive.
Arcoiris is not only a collection of books for children, but also a solidarity project that gives children in poverty the opportunity to obtain basic tools for their development.

What we need
The collection is almost ready, my partners in this adventure and I are working on the design and drawings before printing. Now is when we need your help to take the books to the printing press, the packaging and finally the distribution.If we get more than we have planned, we can go faster with the distribution of books in communities within the country.

story:
Every time, New paper.

You've used certain kinds of common papers. Why don't you try to use other papers that you haven't yet encountered. A variety of unique charm paper contained in one book. Make your creative environment richer by exploring a stupendous paper world!

I'm a junior graphic designer and I made shit every time I printed things cause I don't have enough understanding about papers! It looked great on the screen but horrible when it's printed! I need to get used to bunch of papers in every single day, as fast as possible! So I made this notebook. 

 


Shape your tastes through experience

How about choose a paper according to your preference as you would choose a writing instrument according to your flavor? How would the different sources of paper and manufacturing processes differ if you actually use it? What is the difference between recycled paper and pulp paper? Between 100% recycled paper and partially recycled paper? Between a coated and a non-coated? What about Smooth finish and super smooth finish and between Oxford finish and Linen finish? What kind of paper fits your taste?

 

 

 

Sample chip for CMYK * Print color
and paper characterization information.

Although you print the same color, the colors appear different on each paper. There are many reasons but, most of all, the nature of the paper, the properties that absorb the ink are slightly different. How about choose a paper according to your preference as you would choose a writing instrument according to your liking?

Feel the difference in color directly through the 72note sample chip. The sample chip on each page contains information on paper weight, thickness, materials, recycled paper usage information, the coatings, and the finish methods. Why do you need these? You can check the writing and the printing quality by paper properties. You can also calculate the thickness of the workpiece. The nature of the paper properties can be concerned when choosing a post processing method. You can also experience the difference in durability.
* CMYK = 4 primary colors used in printing. Cyan, Magenta, Yellow, Black

 

it's okay to rip it

The 72note sample chip is small enough to fit in your wallet. Whenever you need to talk about the paper, take a sample chip out and use it wherever and whenever you need it. Why not try to touch it and feel it rather than just talking in words? The whole page can get ripped easily and can be used as a sample paper. This book is bound in a ring binder.

 

 

 


Feel the beauty of paper!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Thank you so much!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Alicia Fleming-Dorsey. I am a wife of 29 yrs., a mother of one child, 2 grandsons, an educator and an activist. I have two college degrees in business and love being an important part of children realizing their potential and soaring to higher heights. Rather a child is in a wheelchair, confronting cancer or playing in a playground, he or she can bring out the superhero in themselves without changing even one thing about how they look. There is no need to wear a cape or mask to be extraordinary, as fun as that can be too.

What We Need & What You Get

I need to raise $75,000, in order to complete my book. The illustrations have already been created. Now, I need to have the technology added to the book and then have it manufactured, here in the United States and marketed.

There are exciting perks offered for different amounts of money that you donate, like getting a shout out on my website so everyone knows that you just contributed to the completion of the book. Bigger donations will get you 1 or more free autographed books. You can also receive them hand delivered, by me. There are perks for larger donations too, like you and I having a meet and greet, for up to 2 hrs., when I hand deliver your signed copies of the book to you. I am also available to do events, for children, at no additional cost for people who donate $10,000.

If I do not meet my campaign goal of $75,000, all donations will go back to the donors and children will not get this incredible book that is about them. So please donate what you can.

The Impact

Your help is valuable in helping to make sure that children know they never have to change anything about themselves, in order, to be awesome and do extraordinary things. It really does take a village to raise a child. You being a part of the village with me assures children that we support their individualism and that difference never means that they cannot accomplish something they set their minds on to accomplish. 

Risks & Challenges

Starting any endeavor has its risks and challenges. Two that I might be faced with are getting the American company that I have right now, who is on standby, to continue to offer me the lowest pricing per quantity of books that are made. My Plan B is to have the books created by my backup manufacturers, if the price increases for the number of books I need to have created.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please donate what you can. No amount is too little. It all adds up and will make a huge difference in getting this book completed and into the hands of every child who thinks that he or she is limited by what he or she can do because they look different.

Please share this link and video with your friends, family and followers, on social media. Ask them to help children become superheroes without having to change anything about the way they look.

Using Indiegogo's share tools at the top right of the Perks section is the best way to SHARE with your friends and family. Thank you so much for your help and donation, my friend.

story:
Short Summary

Hey everyone, my name is Aaron Calimeri. Ded Ninja is my first novella and my first crowd-funded campaign. 

Ded Ninja is a novella that reads like a straight-to-DVD action movie. Jon Ded is just an average guy trying to get by in a world of corruption. He does what he needs to do to survive, which usually means violence. He works as a bounty hunter for a local cartel, but he's no super vigilante and things often go haywire. This is the story of his worst failure yet, and how he gets himself out of major trouble when caught between two rival gangs.

Short version: Jon Ded is an idiot who shoots people, gets in car chases, and sucker punches you in the face.

What We Need & What You Get

I need money to pay for my cover art, as well as printing and shipping.

What you get is an action packed novella that doesn't pull punches and will keep you entertained the entire way.

The Impact

I need you guys to make this dream a reality. If successful, I will not only deliver a great product, but I will be able to create a sequel continuing the adventures of Jon Ded in a brand new setting!

Risks & Challenges

It's always a risk backing a new creator, and I have never written a novella before. 

 

But the good news is, you can check out the first section of the book for free at https://m.tapas.io/series/DedNinja  Just click on Episode #1!

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't back the project at this time, you can still help!

 

Link this Indiegogo on social media and share with your friends! Any help is much appreciated!

story:
Book Blurb

Homeland

Jacob has recently come home from his time in Afghanistan. After two bullets to the chest and shrapnel from an IED, Jacob is holding onto scars both physical and mental. Adjusting to home is has proven to difficult as he can’t seem to let go of the past. Memories of his time in combat haunt his dreams and plagues to wakefulness. He is a soldier that’s unable to move on.

Even though he goes to see his counselor, it hasn’t helped him see through the noise and horror that constantly bombards him. Too many days of living with his guilt of not being able to save friends in combat while he survived has torn him apart. He is a broken man and one without hope. He turns to the one thing he knows. Violence. As the PTSD escalates, he turns to the gun in his nightstand. One-shot, one kill, will the pain end forever, or will he live on to see another day.

I'm Matthew Angelo, a writer and a veteran of the US Armed Forces. The campaign for this novella is important as I want to highlight the realities of what many veterans with PTSD go through daily. There time in combat leaves many scared both mentally and physically and I feel it's essential that others know how deep these scars can run. 

As a contributor, you'll help me get this book started. Even though it's a work of fiction, your contribution will help many open their eyes on what it means to truly support a combat veteran. My ultimate achievement is to see this story come to life and published for all to read.

Are you able to make a contribution, even a small one?

What I Need & What You Get

Here's why I'm pursuing funding for this fiction novella:

  • The book takes time for me to write. This means holding off on some of my work. This negligible amount of cash flow will help greatly.
  • The perks are where you get the fun stuff. I'll have three for major contributors: These include a "thank you" in the acknowledgment section, a copy of the ebook, and the biggest perk, a signed copy of the paperback as soon as its released.
  • The funds will go to help me finish the book for better cover art and editing to make it shine.

Your Impact

As a contributor, you'll see the book come to life and a soldier fight for his life as he faces the day-to-day challenges of PTSD. The veteran suicide rate is 2-a-day. This is a large number and many need to see the reality. Many veterans are homeless and others cannot make their doctor's appointments at the VA. I want this story to reflect what happens in one soldier's life. That way, you can see how important it is to take care of our troops when they come home.

Risks and Challenges

Initially, I would like to seek publication with a small press. Unfortunately, the nature of the story, though fiction, may not sit well with them. If that fails, I'll self-publish, but then come the challenges of marketing and getting the book out there. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that in this economy, few have the money to spare. You can help by sharing the link to this fundraising campaign and letting others know what this story is about.

story:
Hi, my name is Shawna Reppert, and I’m the award-winning author of the Ravensblood series of dark urban fantasy books. The series is set in an alternate-universe version of the Pacific Northwest, mostly Portland and surrounding areas. In the first book, my protagonist, a dark mage seeking redemption, struggles against impossible choices where sometimes death magic is the lesser of the evils. The first book in the series came out in October of 2013, and almost immediately people were begging me to make it available in audiobook.

Audio is not only a convenient and pleasant way to enjoy a book while driving or completing other tasks. For people with visual impairments, it may be the only way to enjoy a book.

That’s where you come in. If you are an audiobook fan, you are aware of how very important it is to have the right narrator. I was lucky enough to meet the incredibly talented narrator Matt Haynes at a science fiction and fantasy convention where we were both panelists. Matt is an Audible Approved Narrator and Producer and has many, many 5-star audiobooks available through Audible. I am positive that he will do justice to this award-winning novel. You don't need to take my word for it, though. Listen to him read a teaser.

I’m asking you to chip in to get the ball rolling with the first book in the series. Any funds raised over and above the production costs for the first book will go to releasing other of my books in audiobook format. I have lots of exciting rewards available to contributors, including free audiobook downloads, Ravenscroft perfume and toiletries, original-cover books for collectors, and so much more! Thank you for your help in making this dream a reality, not only for me but for everyone waiting to hear this book in audio.

story:
Summary

My name is Kingsley Ijomah ​and this is my story. It is about resilience and determination; disability and how I never let mine stop me. It’s about the sport I fell in love with and how your dream can come true if you only keep chipping away at it. It’s the story of how, despite my early years’ experience, I became the first African Paralympian to qualify as a rower in Tokyo 2020. [Please see updates for the latest on Tokyo 2020.)

At 9 months of age, I contracted Polio. It left the muscle on my left leg completely wasted and my right arm slightly weaker than the other. Callipers, wheelchairs and clutches became a part of everyday life as I was unable to walk unaided.

For a young person growing up with a disability future prospects can seem limited, yet I was not one to give up. I found new and unique ways to get involved in different sports, such as water-skiing, wheelchair basketball and football as the goalkeeper for my team. Still, nothing could have prepared me for the day I would become a qualifier for the 2020 Tokyo Paralympics. This was something I could have never envisioned as a child, as I was the least likely of my siblings to become an athlete.

And yet it seems I was destined for the journey. The first time I got into a boat was one of the most exhilarating experiences I’d ever had. I felt like I had walked on water and got such a sense of freedom that I knew it was where I belonged. Had I not attended a dinner party where one of the guests suggested that I should try rowing, or had I let being the only black or disabled member at the club dissuade me, I might have never discovered the sport I have grown to love. In fact, my consistent attendance at the club eventually opened up new adaptive rowing opportunities for around 15 disabled people, which is brilliant since people with disabilities have low levels of participation when it comes to the sport.

 

Why I am writing this book and who it is for

Becoming a 2020 Paralympic Rower has been a journey, one that has involved embracing my disability, seizing opportunities and never giving up. Rowing is a sport of endurance, a sport where you have to get up close and personal with pain, doubt, discouragement and fear. It is not for the faint-hearted and demands all you’ve got and some. But if you think that’s tough, welcome to the world of para-rowing where, like me, you have to find ways to compensate for the lack of muscle tone other rowers take for granted.

I want to share the motivational story of this journey, how I didn’t let my disability stop me from striving to be the best version of myself as I took on the challenge of this gruelling sport. I want to share the lessons I’ve learned, and how you can use them to keep going in your own life to win at what you may even imagine to be farfetched goals.

You’ll love this book if you enjoy real-life stories about people who have overcome tough odds stacked against them. You will appreciate it if you prize stories that can keep you motivated even when you feel tired, that life has dealt you a dud set of cards or like the underdog.

My book will place you centre stage to my journey, so you can see that disability, adversity and setbacks need not prevent you from reaching your potential. Your race to victory need not involve disability or qualifying for the Paralympics as it’s been for me. The lessons I’ve learned are applicable to any area of life where the challenges ahead seem insurmountable. When you read this book I want you to feel like you’ve already won simply because you’re still in the ring.

 

The Book – Paralympian Journey to Tokyo

Paralympian Journey to Tokyo (working title) is divided into 12 life-defining lessons, each sharing a crucial aspect of my journey as I, Kingsley Ijomah, grew from a baby whose parents had been told he would never walk, to a man who has learned to embrace his disability and is competing in the upcoming Paralympics.

This is a book about determination; one that will challenge the perspective of anybody that doubts themselves. It is the story of a young boy who would not let his disability define him. This book will show you what it takes to go from fighting your disability to embracing it, learning from it and excelling with it.

Within these lessons are crucial life principles that will take anybody beyond their current mindset and help them to see that the possibilities for their own journey are endless.

My hope is that you will be inspired by the stories, lessons and principles shared in this book and motivated to begin, continue or resume your own journey of perseverance, going after whatever you believe in and knowing that you can reach your dreams if you persist.

 

Read this book to discover…

  • The story of a young boy with a disability and what it really took for him to make it to the Paralympics.
  • What it means to embrace yourself as you are and appreciate your uniqueness, and how I learned to do this.
  • How to seize opportunities and learn from the people around you, and what this has meant for me.
  • What it means to push yourself the extra mile and methods to help you to stay motivated.
  • The importance of appreciating the life, body and mind that you have and using your time here wisely.
  • How to use incremental gains to build the momentum you need to run and win your best race.
  • How you can explode myths and become a trendsetter, as I’ve done with this real opportunity to become the first African born rower to win a Paralympic medal.
  • And so much more.

I wrote this book to inspire people to know that anything is possible if they go after what they believe in, and learn to see disability, setbacks and differences, not as obstacles but invitations to do things differently.

 

What We Need and What You Get

This book will be self-published with the help of the Editor’s Chair. The pre-order tiers are set up to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The co-writer and publisher I will work with to write and publish my manuscript by June 2020, especially as I train to compete in the Paralympic Rowing Competition.
  • The copyediting for my book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The cover design of my book – the mock-ups you see currently are placeholders.
  • The interior layout design for my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer.
  • A portion of the funds raised will fund visits to a selection of UK schools to inspire especially disabled and disadvantaged young people to get involved in sports or pursue their dreams.

 

Book Campaign Goals

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish an audiobook.

 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive

  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will be listed in a Special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • The opportunity to give me feedback on and be involved in selecting my cover.
  • A personal invitation to the book launch, once the book is published.
  • Exclusive access to my Inner Circle portal with day-to-day video diaries of my training, so that you can follow the journey as I train to row in the Paralympics.
  • This includes tips and advice for solving many of the issues that will also be addressed in the book, such as motivation, pushing yourself and resilience. 
  • Plus, more.

 

About the Author

Kingsley Ijomah is a qualifier for the 2020 Tokyo Paralympics and is competing as a para rower. His days involve vigorous hours of training as he prepares mentally and physically to bring home that medal.

Born in Lagos, Nigeria in 1982, Kingsley relocated to the UK when he was 14 years old and has called England home ever since. He will be the first Nigerian to ever compete in the Paralympics and he strives to win, not just for himself, but his country.

As a young boy, Kingsley spent a great deal of time thinking of appropriate careers for himself.  He became a Software Developer and is the creator of Codehance, an online training programme which teaches coding skills to beginners. Recently, he left his job to dedicate his time to a full-time weekly schedule of vigorous training.

For more information on Kingsley’s journey, go to www.lagostotokyo.com

Risks and Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically mailing the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

I will be working closely with The Editor’s Chair to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

As a qualifier for the Paralympics, my weekly schedule involves six days of vigorous training on top of my job position as a Software Developer. This means my time is divided. I am working with a co-writer to ensure this book is finished and delivered to you on time.

 

Other ways you can help

If you are unable to contribute financially, there are many other ways you can still help:

  • You can share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #paralympiantotokyo and tag me @kingsley.ijomah as well as my publisher/co-writer @editorschair so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can also share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please can you share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. You can do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

All the best

Kingsley Ijomah

SummaryMy name is Kingsley Ijomah ​and this is my story. It is about resilience and determination; disability and how I never let mine stop me. It’s about the sport I fell in love with and how your dream can come true if you only keep chipping away at it. It’s the story of how, despite my early years’ experience, I became the first African Paralympian to qualify as a rower in Tokyo 2020. [Please see updates for the latest on Tokyo 2020.)At 9 months of age, I contracted Polio. It left the muscle on my left leg completely wasted and my right arm slightly weaker than the other. Callipers, wheelchairs and clutches became a part of everyday life as I was unable to walk unaided.For a young person growing up with a disability future prospects can seem limited, yet I was not one to give up. I found new and unique ways to get involved in different sports, such as water-skiing, wheelchair basketball and football as the goalkeeper for my team. Still, nothing could have prepared me for the day I would become a qualifier for the 2020 Tokyo Paralympics. This was something I could have never envisioned as a child, as I was the least likely of my siblings to become an athlete.And yet it seems I was destined for the journey. The first time I got into a boat was one of the most exhilarating experiences I’d ever had. I felt like I had walked on water and got such a sense of freedom that I knew it was where I belonged. Had I not attended a dinner party where one of the guests suggested that I should try rowing, or had I let being the only black or disabled member at the club dissuade me, I might have never discovered the sport I have grown to love. In fact, my consistent attendance at the club eventually opened up new adaptive rowing opportunities for around 15 disabled people, which is brilliant since people with disabilities have low levels of participation when it comes to the sport. Why I am writing this book and who it is forBecoming a 2020 Paralympic Rower has been a journey, one that has involved embracing my disability, seizing opportunities and never giving up. Rowing is a sport of endurance, a sport where you have to get up close and personal with pain, doubt, discouragement and fear. It is not for the faint-hearted and demands all you’ve got and some. But if you think that’s tough, welcome to the world of para-rowing where, like me, you have to find ways to compensate for the lack of muscle tone other rowers take for granted.I want to share the motivational story of this journey, how I didn’t let my disability stop me from striving to be the best version of myself as I took on the challenge of this gruelling sport. I want to share the lessons I’ve learned, and how you can use them to keep going in your own life to win at what you may even imagine to be farfetched goals.You’ll love this book if you enjoy real-life stories about people who have overcome tough odds stacked against them. You will appreciate it if you prize stories that can keep you motivated even when you feel tired, that life has dealt you a dud set of cards or like the underdog.My book will place you centre stage to my journey, so you can see that disability, adversity and setbacks need not prevent you from reaching your potential. Your race to victory need not involve disability or qualifying for the Paralympics as it’s been for me. The lessons I’ve learned are applicable to any area of life where the challenges ahead seem insurmountable. When you read this book I want you to feel like you’ve already won simply because you’re still in the ring. The Book – Paralympian Journey to TokyoParalympian Journey to Tokyo (working title) is divided into 12 life-defining lessons, each sharing a crucial aspect of my journey as I, Kingsley Ijomah, grew from a baby whose parents had been told he would never walk, to a man who has learned to embrace his disability and is competing in the upcoming Paralympics.This is a book about determination; one that will challenge the perspective of anybody that doubts themselves. It is the story of a young boy who would not let his disability define him. This book will show you what it takes to go from fighting your disability to embracing it, learning from it and excelling with it. The importance of appreciating the life, body and mind that you have and using your time here wisely.
How to use incremental gains to build the momentum you need to run and win your best race.

story:
ENGLISH

Do you like writing?

What do you think of a platform to write, share stories and fanfics with alternative endings?

Join us and contribute.

The ArboBook Project

Help us get started with the ArboBook project: online community of writers.

With ArboBook, you can create your stories and fanfics with the possibility of four alternative story endings. With the success of Crowdfounding, we will be able to create all the necessary structure and initial marketing.

The Funds...

The funds will be used for the initial infrastructure needed for the project to be born.

  • Webserver and Databases
  • Development and App publishing fees.
  • Initial marketing

How will it work?

Arbobook will be a lot of fun to write. You can create chapters freely, within a structure with four different endings for the story or fanfic. 

You can access Arbobook through an internet browser, or through future Mobile Apps (Android and iOS). We just need some initial help!

What is individual monetization?

Our project provides for the possibility of individual monetization, using your own Google Adsense code within your history.

It is very simple, you help us and we help you.

What platforms can I use?

Arbobook will be made available on a Web platform (responsive) and mobile applications for Android and iOS will be developed that will allow reading and publishing stories and fanfics.

 

PORTUGUÊS

Gosta de escrever?

O que acha da idéia de ter uma plataforma para escrever e partilhar histórias, contos e fanfics com a possibilidade de criar finais alternativos?

Junte-se a nós e contribua.

O Projecto ArboBook

Ajude-nos a dar o pontapé de saída no projecto Arbobook: comunidade online de escritores.

Com o ArboBook poderá criar as suas histórias e fanfics com a possibilidade de ter quatro finais alternativos. Com o sucesso desse Crowdfounding, conseguiremos criar toda a estrutura inicial necessária e divulgação.

Os Fundos...

Os fundos serão utilizados para adquirir a infraestrutura inicial para que o projecto possa nascer.

  • Servidor e Base de dados
  • Taxas de desenvolvimento e publicação das Apps Mobile.
  • Divulgação inicial.

Como funcionará?

Com o ArboBook será muito divertido escrever. Poderá criar capítulos livremente, dentro de uma estrutura com quatro finais diferetnes para a história.

Poderá aceder ao ArboBook através de um browser de internet, ou através das futuras aplicações Mobile para Android e iOS. Apenas precisamos de uma ajuda inicial.

O que é a monetização individual?

O nosso projecto prevê a possibilidade de monetização da sua história, onde poderá colocar o seu próprio codigo Adsense. Em cada obra, 50% das publicidades que aparecerão será utilizando o seu código Adsense pessoal.

É muito simples, você nos ajuda e nós ajudamos você.

Que plataformas poderei usar?

O ArboBook estará disponível no website (responsive) e em forma de aplicações mobile para Android e iOS que serão desenvolvidos para que possa ler ou publicar histórias mais facilmente.

story:
Rolling Around the World

If Morton's List has ever touched your life, ended your boredom, or given you cherished memories or scars, we call on you now to share in a momentous gift. A global Quest is underway . . . to fulfill the greatest wish of the Morton's List A Trip to Someplace Fresh contest winner, Matt Foy of Muncie, Indiana. Matt was chosen purely by chance to receive this life-changing benefit. His dream destination? The ruins of ancient Sumeria in present-day Iraq - land of the first cities, the first writing, the cradle of civilization itself. Join us in funding this most magnificent Quest yet undertaken. Together we will send Matt to Iraq and make the most implausible adventure an undeniable reality.

Ninja Nate Andren
R. Jesse Deneaux
Morton’s List co-authors
A Trip to Someplace Fresh Contest organizers
 

How We Arrived Here

Atop a Mayan pyramid in the ruins of Tikal, Guatemala at daybreak on December 21, 2012, there began a new type of Morton’s List Quest. Those present were given the Twilight Scroll-level mission to Find Atlantis. Four years later, equipped with the necessary skills and SCUBA gear, the Morton’s List team headed to dive the Bimini Road in the Bahamas for firsthand research. Rolling on the cyclopean underwater blocks they once again consulted Morton’s List for guidance, receiving the Quest of Wish Fulfilled.

Tasked with fulfilling someone’s greatest wish in life, and seeking the next Quest destination, trip organizers and Morton’s List co-authors Ninja Nate Andren and R. Jesse Deneaux launched the A Trip to Someplace Fresh contest. Entrants simply submitted the one place on earth they most wanted to visit, and why. The randomly-rolled winner is Matt Foy and his dream is to connect with the ruins of ancient Sumeria, now in modern-day Iraq. This also happens to be the most distant, unstable, and logistically challenging of all submitted destinations, which is especially fitting for this inaugural event.

With the help of everyone who's ever been entertained by and benefited from the Quests of Morton’s List, as well as everyone you know, we will fund Matt's trip of a lifetime. Join R. Jesse and Ninja Nate in this pioneering crowdfunder for the grandest Morton's List Quest yet. Every penny of the $9k goal goes directly to funding Matt's flights, ground transportation, guides, security, guides, accommodation, delicious meals, and archaeological site entrance fees, as well as production costs for the book, medallion, and other Perks. Organizers have donated hundreds of hours of their time over several years to make this possible, and are happy to receive zero compensation. Fulfilling Matt's wish - with your help - is our singular mission.

Crowdfunder Exclusive Book Edition

Rolling Around the World: Atlantis, Sumeria, and Morton's List
7" x 10", 100+ pages, Full Color, Hardcover, Softcover, eBook
• Collected photos and true life accounts of the story of the Morton’s List trip to Sumeria Iraq. Follow Matt’s improbable journey to Iraq and back, after randomly winning the Morton’s List A Trip to Someplace Fresh contest.
• Dedication Pages with the names of all Hardcore Backers, Medallion Level Allies, Super Ninja Supreme Team Members, and Inner Circle Members of the Highest Level
The Crowdfunder Exclusive Book Edition available to Backers only, includes your personalized quote in addition to your name in the Dedication pages
• Super Ninja Supreme Team 2-page spread featuring all Super Ninja Supreme Team member pictures
• Inner Circle Member of the Highest Level dedicated 1-page spreads for every individual claiming this Perk
 

Book Stretch Goals . . .

Reaching our Book Stretch Goals unlocks bonus additions to the Rolling Around the World book, like never-before-published tales from decades of legendary Morton's List adventures, and may even reveal stories from the earliest days of Morton's List . . .
90+ Backers unlocks all the adventures and underwater photos from the 2016 Morton's List dive trip to Bimini, where the Wish Fulfilled Quest was rolled, setting the Iraq trip in motion. The eBook version of Rolling Around the World will also be added to every $30+ Perk.
180+ Backers unlocks the lush, tropical story and photos from the 2012 Morton's List trip to Guatemala for the dawn of B'ak'tun 13 on the Mayan Calendar, and the Find Atlantis Quest, leading to the Bimini dive.
270+ Backers unlocks rare, archival stories and photos from the Karmic Gatherings of the mid 2000s in such locations as Michigan, Tennessee, Florida, and Alaska.
360+ Backers unlocks deep, esoteric stories of the making of Morton's List from the earliest days, including never before seen art, and many more mysteries revealed.
 

Travel Stretch Goals . . .

$13k upgrades the entire travel package to a fully private and all-Sumerian experience with Alwaseilah Tours!
$20k sends a second random person* on the private tour - and it could be you!
$30k sends a third person* on the private tour - for another chance to join for free!
*No cost. Details will be released when this stretch goal is unlocked.
 

Join the Trip . . .

$4.5k+ to join Matt on this Quest of a lifetime. Serious inquiries . . . mortonslist@gmail.com
 

The Impact of Success

There is no greater reward than coming together to make someone’s wish come true. Matt’s is to walk among the ruins of the most ancient civilizations known to man. Succeeding in this brave venture proves the Inner Circle of Morton’s List supporters is capable of manifesting anything. Building upon our many successful Morton’s List trips across the US and to Guatemala and The Bahamas, Quests to randomly chosen destinations represent a new frontier for Morton's List. When this daring wish succeeds, it opens the door for all to join future Morton's List events and destination Quests.
 

Risks & Challenges

Every aspect of this expedition has been thoroughly researched and planned, with the guidance of experienced local tour operators. $9k will fund all crowdfunder rewards and 7 days of all-inclusive travel throughout Iraq. Matt’s touchdown in Baghdad is currently scheduled for Monday, March 8th, 2021 with flexibility to adjust to any international travel restrictions. If the Global Inner Circle cannot raise $9k, we will continue to make every effort to get Matt to Sumeria. We would then ask backers not to request refunds, and instead to forgo medallions, using their high production cost to instead cover trip expenses. If further project cost reduction is required, the book could be released solely as an eBook. Without the expense of these rewards, the total travel cost is about $5.5k. If we cannot raise even that amount, we will automatically refund all donations and move on to other projects.

We acknowledge that safety is most people's primary concern, and that the US State Department advises the average US citizen against traveling to Iraq. Matt and those organizing this expedition are experienced and resourceful international travelers, ready to adapt to changing situations on the ground. Itineraries and travel plans remain flexible to account for the global pandemic, and shifting geopolitical realities. Of all the destinations that could have been randomly rolled, Sumeria was chosen by the Morton Boulder. It is now our challenge to make this unlikely destiny real. Give now at the highest level you can, as we grant A Trip to Someplace Fresh through the limitless Karma of the Inner Circle.
 

2021 and You

Morton’s List opens the way for many experiences, and this Quest merges adventure, travel, life goals, and the ultimate mysteries of the Anunnaki. We kindly ask that you share this with anyone who might support such a worthwhile goal, and we thank you for any level of support.

Karma Always,

Morton’s List co-authors
A Trip to Someplace Fresh Contest Organizers
Ninja Nate Andren - game designer, Stranger Tale: The Party Game of Amazing Memories
R. Jesse Deneaux - game designer, Druglord: Lord of Drugs
#mortonslist  #sumeriaquest
