story:
Az albumról röviden

Ezzel a könyvvel egy pótolhatatlan összegzést tarthat kezében az olvasó. Ugyanis a Klotildligettel kapcsolatos kordokumentumok, iratok, tervek, lejegyzések a második világháború során mind elpusztultak. Ezzel Klotildliget, amely a maga korának egyik legcsodálatosabb elgondolása volt, egy csapásra fehér folt lett a művészettörténet és a történettudomány számára. Soha senki nem tartotta lehetségesnek feltérképezni múltját. Egészen mostanáig.

A szerző, Vörös Ildikó művészettörténész és esztéta a Pázmány Péter Katolikus Egyetemen végzett 2005-ben. Művészettörténet szakon leadott diplomamunkája képezi a Klotildliget című könyv alapját. A későbbi évek során bővítményekkel és gazdag képanyaggal egészítette ki munkáját, amely végül tökéletes részletességgel mutatja be ennek a paradicsomi miliőjű villaparknak létrejöttét, mindennapjait és átalakulását a századfordulótól napjainkig. A szerző – saját bevallása szerint – nem korokra, hanem mások által feltárhatatlannak tartott történelmi és művészettörténeti témákra szakosodott. Ennek a lehetetlennek tartott munkának az eredménye ez az album, amely annyira impozánsra sikeredett, hogy az olvasó számára Klotildliget történetének minden perce és lakóinak teljes élete megelevenedik a lapokon. Miközben történeti és művészettörténeti áttekintést kapunk Klotildligetről, betekintést nyerünk a kor társadalmi életébe és a villák lakóinak mindennapjaiba, eredeti visszaemlékezések alapján. A könyvet számos korabeli képeslap és dokumentum gazdag illusztrációja teszi még izgalmasabbá. Isten hozta Klotildligeten! Lépjen be a csodás, századfordolós villanegyedbe!

Kedvezményes előrendelési lehetőség (perkek):

Az album kiskereskedelmi fogyasztói ára várhatóan 5.600 HUF lesz. A megjelenés előtt közösségi finanszírozás keretében előrendelhető a könyv. Ez segíti a mihamarabbi megjelenést, lehetőség, hogy kedvezményes áron szerezzék meg az albumot, nevük megjelenjen a támogatók között és akár egyedi ajándékokhoz is juthatnak, mint pl. képeslap és naptár. A csomagok korlátozott számban állnak rendelkezésre. Választani a jobb oldalon megjelenő csomagajánlatok (perk) közül lehet.

Klotildligetről

A XIX-XX. század fordulóján Magyarország egész területén folytak építkezések, amelynek produktumai méltán nevezhetők szimbólumértékű emlékeknek. A módos arisztokraták és a gazdagabb polgárság hatalmas épületeikkel, kastélyaikkal, kúriáikkal, villáikkal, emlékhelyeikkel nemcsak a kor elismerését akarták kivívni, de az utódaikra hagyott alkotásokkal saját, átvitt értelemben vett, halhatatlanságukat is biztosítani akarták. Ez az ellentmondásokra épülő kor a béke és a fejlődés röpke időszaka volt. Akkor még nem tudhatták, illetve kevesen sejthették, hogy ez a boldogság már a háború előszele, a tragédiát jelző “vihar előtti csend” volt. Úgy tartják, aki meg akarja ismerni a magyar történelmet, elég, ha kastélyaink és villáink sorsát követi nyomon. Ez különösen igaz Klotildligetre, amely a történelem ilyetén alakulásának tükörképévé vált.

A boldog békeidők társadalmának életét körvonalazza a villatelep megvalósítása. A meginduló vasútépítés kapukat nyitott a fővároshoz közeli erdők beépítésére, így a pilisi táj egyik gyönyörű domboldalát József főherceg tervei alapján felparcellázták és jó pénzért eladták, hogy a pompás utcák mentén a későbbi lakók csinos, kis villákat emeljenek. Klotildliget helyszínrajza jól mutatja, milyen nagy precizitással tervezték meg az utcák vonalát, és osztották fel a lankás, néhol meredek területet. Közvetlen ezután, a mesés botanikai kertekkel rendelkező birtokairól hires főherceg elrendelte az utcák fásítását. Ennek eredményeképpen máig egyedülálló utcaképek jöttek létre. Az utak portalanításáról is gondoskodtak, s makadámos burkolatot építettek, szélüket faragott fakockákkal szegélyezték.

A telektulajdonosoknak kikötötték, hogy villáikat az utcafronttól minimum hat méter távolságban epíthetik fel, így az épületek és kerítések között újabb kerteket alakítottak ki. Néhány helyütt, ahol a terepviszonyok megkívánták, magas támfalakat emeltek, amelyeket díszes kovácsoltvas kapu tett még fenségesebbé. Az egész környék maga volt a paradicsomi nyugalom. Klotildliget kávéházakkal, hangulatos vendéglőkkel, öt uszodával és ugyanennyi teniszpályával is rendelkezett. “A villa előtti verandán szólt a grámofon, így aki nem teniszezett, táncolhatott vagy az asztaloknál beszélgethetett. Fiatalok és idősebbek egyaránt kedvelték ezeket az összejöveteleket, ahol nagyszerű társaság gyűlt egybe.” – emlékezett vissza Nagybaczoni Nagy Vilma gyermekkora emlékeire.

A történelem viszontagságai azonban Klotildligetet sem kímélték. Amikor a munkámba belekezdtem, Klotildliget a kutatás számára még feldolgozatlan terület volt. Az egykor volt nagyszabású építkezések és pezsgő élet után, a második világháború pusztításainak köszönhetően, a villatelep végleg Csipkerózsika-álomba merült. A telkeket felosztották, és beépítették, a megmaradt épületek többségét átalakították. Napjainkra a villákat már nem az építtetők leszármazottai lakják, s a negyed régi fényét őrző korabeli emlékanyagok is szétszóródtak. Kihívásokkal teli, feltáró munkám meglehetősen kilátástalannak tűnt. A hosszú kutatás eredményeképpen azonban sikerült elbeszélésekből és előkerült dokumentumokból rekonstruálni Klotildliget történetét és egykori életét, mely kétségkívül izgalmas időutazásra invitál bennünket.

A XIX-XX. század fordulóján Magyarország egész területén folytak építkezések, amelynek produktumai méltán nevezhetők szimbólumértékű emlékeknek. A módos arisztokraták és a gazdagabb polgárság hatalmas épületeikkel, kastélyaikkal, kúriáikkal, villáikkal, emlékhelyeikkel nemcsak a kor elismerését akarták kivívni, de az utódaikra hagyott alkotásokkal saját, átvitt értelemben vett, halhatatlanságukat is biztosítani akarták. Ez az ellentmondásokra épülő kor a béke és a fejlődés röpke időszaka volt. Akkor még nem tudhatták, illetve kevesen sejthették, hogy ez a boldogság már a háború előszele, a tragédiát jelző “vihar előtti csend” volt. Úgy tartják, aki meg akarja ismerni a magyar történelmet, elég, ha kastélyaink és villáink sorsát követi nyomon. Ez különösen igaz Klotildligetre, amely a történelem ilyetén alakulásának tükörképévé vált.
A boldog békeidők társadalmának életét körvonalazza a villatelep megvalósítása. A meginduló vasútépítés kapukat nyitott a fővároshoz közeli erdők beépítésére, így a pilisi táj egyik gyönyörű domboldalát József főherceg tervei alapján felparcellázták és jó pénzért eladták, hogy a pompás utcák mentén a későbbi lakók csinos, kis villákat emeljenek. Klotildliget helyszínrajza jól mutatja, milyen nagy precizitással tervezték meg az utcák vonalát, és osztották fel a lankás, néhol meredek területet. Közvetlen ezután, a mesés botanikai kertekkel rendelkező birtokairól hires főherceg elrendelte az utcák fásítását. Ennek eredményeképpen máig egyedülálló utcaképek jöttek létre. Az utak portalanításáról is gondoskodtak, s makadámos burkolatot építettek, szélüket faragott fakockákkal szegélyezték.
A telektulajdonosoknak kikötötték, hogy villáikat az utcafronttól minimum hat méter távolságban epíthetik fel, így az épületek és kerítések között újabb kerteket alakítottak ki. Néhány helyütt, ahol a terepviszonyok megkívánták, magas támfalakat emeltek, amelyeket díszes kovácsoltvas kapu tett még fenségesebbé. Az egész környék maga volt a paradicsomi nyugalom. Klotildliget kávéházakkal, hangulatos vendéglőkkel, öt uszodával és ugyanennyi teniszpályával is rendelkezett. “A villa előtti verandán szólt a grámofon, így aki nem teniszezett, táncolhatott vagy az asztaloknál beszélgethetett. Fiatalok és idősebbek egyaránt kedvelték ezeket az összejöveteleket, ahol nagyszerű társaság gyűlt egybe.” – emlékezett vissza Nagybaczoni Nagy Vilma gyermekkora emlékeire.
A történelem viszontagságai azonban Klotildligetet sem kímélték. Amikor a munkámba belekezdtem, Klotildliget a kutatás számára még feldolgozatlan terület volt. Az egykor volt nagyszabású építkezések és pezsgő élet után, a második világháború pusztításainak köszönhetően, a villatelep végleg Csipkerózsika-álomba merült. A telkeket felosztották, és beépítették, a megmaradt épületek többségét átalakították. Napjainkra a villákat már nem az építtetők leszármazottai lakják, s a negyed régi fényét őrző korabeli emlékanyagok is szétszóródtak. Kihívásokkal teli, feltáró munkám meglehetősen kilátástalannak tűnt. A hosszú kutatás eredményeképpen azonban sikerült elbeszélésekből és előkerült dokumentumokból rekonstruálni Klotildliget történetét és egykori életét, mely kétségkívül izgalmas időutazásra invitál bennünket.

story:
FOR ENGLISH, PLEASE SCROLL DOWN

***Uppdatering*** Nya sänkta priser på boken! Beställ boken innan 9 april. Vi måste nå vårt mål innan dess, annars får alla som stöttat oss pengarna tillbaks, vi får inga alls och kommer inte kunna trycka boken. Du beställer boken genom att klicka på det alternativ du önskar i listan. Genom att stötta oss nu, stöttar du vår kampanj och att vi överhuvudtaget kan trycka vår bok. Det är nu vi behöver ditt stöd! Köp vår bok innan 9 april!

Vår bok, Liva och Kungariket Små Grå, riktar sig till de lite yngre barnen och handlar om att upptäcka naturen och vad som kan gömma sig under en sten i skogen. Jag som har skrivit boken heter Wai Ching Yuesdotter och detta är min första barnbok. Maria Öqvist är illustratören som har gjort de fina färgillustrationerna till boken. Du kan se mer av Marias konst på hennes hemsida www.mariaoqvist.se.

Som komplement till själva sagan, har vi gjort en naturpysselbok som är en interaktiv målarbok där barnen får uppgifter att först gå ut i naturen och sedan rita sina upplevelser i boken.

Boken kommer att tryckas i högsta kvalitet, på miljömärkt papper och med vegetabiliskt bläck. Själva boken kommer att bli en inbunden bok i fyrfärg i A4-format, medan naturpysselboken kommer att bli häftad i A4-format med svartvit inlaga.

***Uppdatering*** Tack vare nya tryckpriser kommer boken att tryckas och levereras på båda språken om vi når vårt kampanjmål, dvs om du beställer boken på svenska så kommer du få den på svenska. Tidigare har vi reserverat oss och sagt att vi måste nå upp till ett minsta antal beställningar på svenska för att kunna tryckas på svenska, men det gäller alltså inte längre :)

Du beställer boken genom att klicka på det alternativ du önskar i perks-listan.

Tack för att ni hjälper oss att trycka vår första barnbok!

Wai Ching Yuesdotter och Maria Öqvist

 

***Update*** New lower prices! Thanks to lower printing prices, we can now offer our books at new lower prices. But remember, we still have to reach our campaign goal before April 9 to be able to print the book and send it to our backers. If we don't reach our goal, all our backers will be refunded and we will get no money to print the book. 

We have written an illustrated children's book that we have decided to publish ourselves. We're now launching a crowdfunding campaign to raise enough funds to make the first printing of our book. You can contribute by pre-ordering a book by clicking on one of the options on the list to the right. All contributors will be able to choose to get a signed copy of the book as a special thank you from us.

Our book, Liva and the Kingdom of Small Grey, tells the story about discovering nature and what might be hidden under a rock in the woods. As a complement to the hardcover book, we have made an interactive colouring book, the Inspiration & Creativity Book, where the child will get to draw her/his own experiences of nature. 

The books will be printed in highest quality, on eco-labelled paper using vegetable based ink.

Thank you for helping us publish our first book!

Wai Ching Yuesdotter and Maria Öqvist

 

 

Liva and the Kingdom of Small Grey is the first book that will be released by SheoBio Publishing and Productions. We hope to publish many more books and also create animations for children in the future. The aim with all our productions is to create high quality media that reconnects children with nature and to bring them good and positive stories with hand drawn illustrations. Knowing what it is like to be highly sensitive or to have highly sensitive children, we also want our productions to be HSC-friendly, so that children can watch and read them without becoming over-stimulated, stressed, scared or frightened.

SheoBio Publishing & Productions startades av oss för att kunna trycka vår bok Liva och Kungariket Små Grå. Vår förhoppning är att publicera många fler barnböcker och även skapa animerade produktioner för barn. Vi vill att våra produktioner ska göra barn nyfikna på naturen och samtidigt berätta härliga sagor och historier för barnen. Då vi tycker det är viktigt vad för input vi ger våra barn, ser vi till att våra produktioner inte är stressande, skrämmande, innehåller våld, elakheter m.m. Hos SheoBio Publishing & Productions kommer du bara att hitta positiva och glada produktioner!

story:
Breve reseña

Somos el equipo Nutrias del Gimnasio de Usos Múltiples (GUM) de La Paz, BCS. Con el entusiasmo de nuestra entrenadora, Fernanda Espinosa,  como el año pasado, el 4 de octubre de 2015 nadaremos en el evento Por ellas... somos uno, Brazadas en Pro de la Prevención del Cáncer. 

Es una iniciativa para nadar por una causa importante, surgió en 2006 y cada año crece el número de nadadores y donantes que aportamos nuestro granito de arena para ayudar a prevenir esta enfermedad.  

Nadaremos 35 km en relevos (ocho nadadores), pero lo más importante es RECAUDAR fondos para prevenir el cáncer. Puedes consultar más información en www.porellasmexico.mx 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Tus donaciones irán a la asociación civil Sudcalifornia Contra el Cáncer Infantil (SUDCCAI) www.sudccai.org .

Tus donativos son deducibles de impuestos.

La cuota de ingreso al evento la cubriremos nosotros. Todo lo que recaudemos va íntegro para la prevención del cáncer en BCS.

El impacto

Con tus donaciones ayudas a prevenir el cáncer en uno de los lugares de México con mayor incidencia de esta enfermedad.

Particularmente puedes ayudar a prevenir y apoyar los tratamientos contra el cáncer infantil. 

Además ayudas a mantener una iniciativa que recauda a través del deporte. 

Riesgos y desafíos

El desafío es nadar aproximadamente 10 hrs (35 km) en 4 relevos de dos nadadores. El nado es en pareja por medias horas. Cada media hora cambiamos de pareja. La pareja que sale del agua ¨se vuelve a formar¨ para entrar nuevamente al agua cuando las otras tres parejas hayan nadado. De esa forma nadaremos hasta completar el recorrido.

Siempre hay riesgos en el nado de aguas abiertas, pero este evento tiene una excelente organización y estamos entrenando para lograrlo.

El VERDADERO riesgo es no contribuir con nuestros donativos, ya que son un requisito para nadar. 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

¡Ayúdanos a difundir nuestra campaña!

story:
(EN)Greetings, please share this crowdfunding initiative! My goal is to print and publish a book of collaborations and works of musical history, please don't stop sharing as your support will be of great help.

(ES)hola gracias ante todo, revisa esta campaña de crowdfunding para lograr imprimir y publicar mi libro que colabora con la historia musical. No dudes en compartir, de verdad esos seria de gran ayuda.


Breve reseña (ES) - Brief review (EN)


(EN) coming soon. grammatical arrangements

Graphic History of Rock in Venezuela emerged in 2013 versus the need for Work Grade necessary for obtaining title "Bachelor of Arts Graphic Design Mention". This work was accomplished with the effort and thorough investigation of history that encompasses the Venezuelan Pop & rock and its evolution around these 55 years of musical history in the genre. He also had the support of various researchers, artists, designers albums, music bands, among others who lost the job was unfolding to reach it is today, the nearest reference and catalog Figure history embodied in the Venezuelan Rock genre.(ES)

La Historia Gráfica del Rock en Venezuela surge en el año 2013 frente a la necesidad de realizar  el Trabajo de Grado necesario para la obtención del titulo "Licenciado en Artes Mención Diseño Gráfico".  Dicho trabajo se logro con el esfuerzo y la  investigación exhaustiva de la historia que engloba al Pop & rock Venezolano así como su evolución al rededor de estos 55 años de Historia musical en el genero.  Se contó también con el apoyo de diversos Investigadores, Artistas, Diseñadores de álbumes, Bandas musicales, entre otros que perdieron que el trabajo se fuera desenvolviendo hasta llegar a los que es hoy, El referente mas cercano y catalogo de la historia Gráfica plasmada en el genero Rock Venezolano.


¿Quien soy? ¿Como Empieza todo? (ES) - Who I am? How it all begins? (EN)


(EN) coming soon. grammatical arrangements

The idea came on the need to generate a graphic project that meets the high standards of today's market, but not only in the graphic medium but also in content and research. In the process go through various challenges as it was being a young man with little knowledge of the beginning of the musical genre that more listening, my closest experience with tales story was and how little fellow could read in those moments and blog pages News of rock.When I have to create a theme for the thesis (Degree Work), managed to identify the way which wanted to get (something that could gather the evolution of the Venezuelan rock graphically) but the biggest drawback was to focus the ideas and make them feasible as it was not but just think of the idea see it, take it, digest it and lower it to the final product.



The name selection process that would initiate the project was born of mutual understanding between Shaindel Arana my tutor and myself focused on the issues that I could handle and more areas where I desvolviese study during the race, going almost 2 months of proposals and proposals are often rejected by clichés makes it to a topic that would break with tradition made for this school "ANALYSIS OF STRUCTURES APPLIED GRAPHIC DESIGN GRAPHIC PACKAGING MUSICAL GENRE ROCK FROM 1950 TO 2014 IN VENEZUELA" a rather complex and difficult to understand at first instant issue, your idea or feature was based on generating research that could generate and present the evolution of graphic design exerted on the covers of music albums of the genre rock & pop in Venezuela, but this based on a time period that was from its beginnings to the present which at that time was that 2014 was the year the project was delivered.The first clash with the reality that I had to handle was the realization that from the 50s to the 80s was almost non-existent material on the web site for one frequents the years in finding and principles of any investigation reminding the phrase "If you are not online, does not exist". Venezuelan rock practically non-existent or at least not easily on the Internet, what little there was in network were outdated the genus blog covering most of all 90 onwards. Have submitted a proposal with such extensive research date was a challenge, covering all history of a genre from its inception to the present. The more searching I realized that he was involved in a terrible emptiness informative and that the best solution was to seek written texts, by then I had only knowledge of books much textual content and less graphic, that's where I get the final approach and Goal of the project.

(La Discoteca - Vicente Corostola)

The first contact that achievement have the historical world of Venezuelan rock comes five months after the presentation of the theme and be approved to work it, this comes at Hacienda Trinity with the presentation of "The Disco" an exhibition of more than 400 discs , anecdotes, book collection, packaging, and other content that had to do with the subject of rock in Venezuela. This exhibition was distributed and fully organized by chronological date by a stroll through rooms. This was the main source of information to compile the first graphic Venezuelan rock. That day is someone who support the draft and would be the second person can lend their knowledge to expand research Eddio pineapple with his publishing project The History of Rock in Venezuela present.The design process was complicated, the optencion of the covers was most of all photographs taken THROUGH albums they then passed to a process of editing, restoration and motaje. The discs of this period are difficult to obtain in an excellent state because in those times the owners marked and signed by way of protecting its collection.

Little by little it was getting a lot more information and started to flesh out what the design and material of the book, making possible to make a nice tour while reading discs with their anecdotes were located (obtained often the artists themselves) and curiosities about this album.

This research counted in his time with the research content of 890 albums from 1958 to 2014, currently the repertoire until 2015 will by 1400 music albums between LP and EP, reference information, biographies and anecdotes multiple bands themselves.

The book was developed with a start in the genre surgimiendo rock and roll, then he runs like that genre and flows to Latin America, reaching what is Venezuela. Showing the history of what took place in those times as it was moving both the country and its musical culture.
(ES)

La Idea surge bajo la necesidad de generar un proyecto gráfico que cumpliera con los altos estándares de calidad del mercado actual, pero  no solo en el medio gráfico si no también en su contenido como materia de investigación. En el proceso pase por diversos retos como fue el ser un joven con pocos conocimientos del inicio del genero musical que mas escuchaba, mi experiencia mas cercana con la historia era los cuentos de compañeros y lo poco que podía leer en esos momentos en blog y paginas de noticias del rock nacional. 

Cuando me toca generar un tema para la Tesis (Trabajo de Grado), logro identificar el camino al cual quería llegar (Algo que pudiera recopilar la evolución del rock venezolano gráficamente) pero el mayor inconveniente era centrar las ideas y hacerlas factibles ya que no era solo pensar la idea sino verla, tomarla, digerirla y bajarla al producto final. 

El proceso de selección del nombre que daría inicio al proyecto nace del mutuo entendimiento entre mi tutora Shaindel Arana y mi persona enfocado en los temas que yo podía manejar y las áreas donde mas me desvolviese en el transcurso de estudio de la carrera, pasando casi 2 meses de propuestas y propuestas frecuentemente rechazadas por clichés se logra llegar a un tema que rompería con lo tradicional hecho para dicha escuela "ANÁLISIS DE LAS ESTRUCTURAS DE DIAGRAMACIÓN APLICADAS AL DISEÑO GRÁFICO DEL EMPAQUE MÚSICAL DEL GÉNERO ROCK DESDE EL AÑO 1950 HASTA 2014 EN VENEZUELA" un tema algo complejo y difícil de comprender en primer instante, su idea o función estaba basada en generar una investigación que pudiera generar y presentar la evolución del diseño gráfico ejercido sobre las portadas de los álbumes musicales del genero rock & pop en Venezuela, pero esto basado en un periodo de tiempo que era desde sus inicios hasta la actualidad que en dicho  momento era el año 2014 que fue el año se entrego el proyecto. 

El primer choque con la realidad que tuve que manejar fue el darme cuenta que desde la década de los 50 hasta los 80 era casi inexistente el material en la web, sitio que para estos años uno suele frecuentar en la búsqueda y principios de cualquier investigación recordándome aquella frase "Si no esta en internet, no existe" . Prácticamente el rock venezolano no existía o por lo menos no de manera sencilla en Internet, lo poco que había en la red eran blog desactualizados del genero que cubrían mas que todo del 90 en adelante. Haber presentado una propuesta con una fecha tan extensa de investigación era un reto, abarcaba la totalidad de historia de un genero desde su surgimiento hasta su presente. Mientras mas buscaba me daba cuenta que estaba metido en un tremendo vació informativo y que la mejor solución era buscar los textos escritos, para ese entonces solo tuve conocimiento de libros de mucho contenido  textual y menos gráfico, es ahí donde consigo el enfoque final y la meta de dicho proyecto. 

(La Discoteca - Vicente Corostola)

El primer contacto directo que logro tener con el mundo histórico del rock venezolano surge 5 meses después de presentado el tema y estar aprobado para trabajarlo, este surge en La hacienda la trinidad con la presentación de "La Discoteca" una exposición con mas de 400 Discos, anécdotas, colección de libros, empaques y demás contenido que tenia que ver con el tema del rock en Venezuela. Dicha exposición estaba distribuida y totalmente organizada por fecha cronológica mediante un pasea a través de salas. Esta fue la principal fuente de información para recopilar las primeras gráficas del rock venezolano. Ese mismo día se presento una persona que apoyaría el proyecto y seria la segunda persona capaz de prestar su conocimiento para ampliar la investigación Eddio Piña con su proyecto editorial La Historia del Rock en Venezuela.

El proceso de diseño fue complicado, la optencion de las caratulas era mas que todo atraves de fotografias tomadas a los propios albumes que luego pasaban a un proceso de edicion, restauracion y motaje. Los discos de esta epoca son dificiles de conseguir en un estado excelente debido a que en esos tiempo los dueños los marcaban y firmaban a modo de proteger su coleccion.

Poco a poco se fue obteniendo muchas mas informacion y se empezo a darle cuerpo a lo que es el diseño y material del libro, logrando que fuera posible hacer un recorrido agradable durante su lectura, se ubicaron los discos con sus respectivas anecdotas (Sacadas muchas veces de los mismos artistas) y curiosidades sobre dicho album.

Dicha investigacion en su tiempo conto con el contenido investigativo de 890 Albumes desde 1958 hasta el 2014, actualmente el repertorio hasta el año 2015 va por 1400 albumes musicales entre LP y EP, informacion de referencia, multiples biografias y anecdotas de las propias bandas.

El libro se desarrolla con un inicio en el surgimiendo el genero rock and roll, luego como ese genero corre y  fluye por latinoamerica, llegando a lo que es Venezuela. Mostrando la historia de lo que se vivio en esas epocas y como fue avanzando tanto el pais como su cultura musical.

story:
Short Summary

At BrightStar Publishing, we work with our writers every step of the way on their literary journey, helping to bring out the most from their work. From an idea and rough draft, to editing and publication, BrightStar helps our authors produce high quality, interesting, and entertaining books. At BrightStar Publishing we believe that everyone has a story to tell, and that every story deserves to be told. Join us as we amplify the voices in the LGBTQ+ community.

What We Need & What You Get

  • $5,000 is enough to get off the ground. The funding will establish a base for the company such as registering the company and gathering all the necessary documents, publishing our first book, and marketing to get our name out there so we can help others in our community.
  • We have bookish perks!! Visit our perks to see what you can get :)
  • If we don't reach our goal, the funds will still go to what was stated above. The more funding, the more we can expand.

The Impact

Why is BrightStar Publishing exclusively an LGBTQ+ publishing house?

Simple.

Because the only time our community is acknowledged is when we're a trend or we're published simply so the publishing company looks more diverse. It rarely seems genuine when we're published because our stories are well written and thought out, or that our stories are powerful enough to be heard.

Don't get us wrong. It is a huge accomplishment to be published and if you're in the LGBTQ+ community and have a written work published, it doesn't mean you were chosen for the negative reasons stated above. We're just saying we don't want to be a trend. We deserve to tell our stories just as much as anyone else.

So that's why BrightStar publishes novels written by and featuring the LGBTQ+ community. We want to be a hub for writers and readers alike to have easy access to resources, titles in our community, blog posts, news and trending topics in the book community, and so much more!

We hope you'll stick around and support a Publishing House that wants to make sure everyone feels like they're part of the family.

Risks & Challenges

  • We are passionate about BrightStar Publishing. Even if we don't receive any donations, we are still actively trying to build this company up. This publishing house is more than a publishing house. It's a community, a family even, that we want YOU to be a part of. Because we're so passionate, no matter the obstacle, we're determined to get over it. We will face a lot of discrimination and people who don't believe in us, but that'll just boost our morale.
  • We are a small publishing company so marketing and selling books is going to be a huge issue, but one we're determined to solve nonetheless. Our passion will drive us to put money that will satisfy us and the authors.

Other Ways You Can Help

It's okay if you can't donate!! Don't worry or feel bad. There are plenty of other ways to help us without it being monetary. Funding just makes starting the business easier and we'll be able to get our message across faster. Donations mean the world to us.

Here are other ways you can help:

  • Spread the word! Even something as simple as telling others about us can make us gain traction. Not even just donating, but helping us build brand awareness. Follow us on all of our socials (Twitter, Instagram, Facebook), tag us online, tells others about us when you're talking to them.
  • Join our mailing list. This helps a lot and all you have to do is just enter your email! We don't spam, and you can unsubscribe at any time if you're unsatisfied.
  • Joining our team. We are currently looking for bloggers or social media strategists and much much more to help get this business off the ground. It takes a team of us to spread this message!

story:
Dear Backers, 

Five years ago, I started writing the story of Salou which you will be able to discover in the review attached below. Today, the manuscript is getting ready to be published by the end of the year, hopefully around Christmas, 2021. 

The fundraising I am launching here is essentially to finance the remaining stages of this project which is extremely dear to my heart, namely the printing, design, typeset, warehouse storage and marketing. 

For those of you interested in a beautiful, yet challenging love story between two characters from different cultural backgrounds, facing unexpected and dramatic life circumstances, the story of Salou will transport you from Paris to Conakry and San Francisco, along side Benjamin and Salou, the main protagonists. This journey should be memorable as you will follow them up close through their trials, experience the realities they face and live their emotions, desires and contradictions. The story of Salou is inspired from true events, some of which I had the privilege of witnessing first-hand while growing up in Central Africa. 

I am convinced that it will enthrall you and I cannot wait to see it on the shelves of renowned libraries - physical or virtual, and in yours hands. 

I take this opportunity to thank you for your contribution which I commit to put to good use in making the publication of this novel a reality. 

I will be reachable through my author website - currently in construction, or on Instagram at morenike_mcfaal, and will be keeping you updated on progress. I pledge that if anything were to change, you would be the first to know. 

Again, many thanks for your support for the story of Salou, and by doing so, for me as a first-time author. 

Very best, 

Morenike McFaal 

MORENIKE

 

REVIEW 

McFaal’s novel opens with civil unrest in Guinea—the year is 2006, and Sheikh Kassai has just asked his driver to stop the car. He has spotted a battered woman in the street and brings her into the safety of his vehicle in order to transport her to the hospital. As he tends to the woman attacked by soldiers, little does Sheikh know that his own daughter Salou, who lives in Paris, has just experienced traumatic injuries in a hit and run, and is herself unconscious and hospitalized.

Benjamin—the doctor assigned to her care—falls deeply in love with her as her presence helps him further heal from losing his wife and the mother of his young daughter. But when Salou’s long-lost mother shows up at her doorstep with Paul, Salou’s former love interest bent on getting her back in his life, Salou is torn between the past and present. Salou chooses the present, and the bride and groom experience a one-of-a-kind adventure when a meet-the-parents trip to Africa challenges Benjamin to prove himself worthy of Salou’s hand in marriage. Ultimately, all of this drama pales in comparison when a military coup strikes, resulting in the imprisonment of Salou and her family. Will Benjamin save the day, or will Paul step back out of the shadows?

Eloquent, touching and grounded in rich detail, the story succeeds at transporting us into a most unique family drama, where our characters must cope with the unexpected changes that come as a result of Salou’s tragic accident. McFaal demonstrates that physical healing is only the tip of the iceberg when it comes to a near-fatal blow. How fragile life is, and how delicate and complex love is, is the message looming at the forefront of the beautifully crafted tension present in McFaal's novel.

THE FACE WHICH INSPIRED THE STORY 

 

THE BIRTH OF SALOU

Hello Dear!

My name is Morenike McFaal, first time author. I am taking a moment here to briefly introduce myself and tell you about my upcoming project that you’ll be generously supporting.

The story of Salou started many years back when I was still a young girl living with my parents in Yaoundé, Cameroon.

Crouched behind the large curtains separating the bedrooms quarters from the living room, I would listen with all the attention of an 8-year-old, to the love story of a young doctor, colleague of my father, who flew from France to ask in marriage the hand of his beautiful fiancée. It took weeks for the story to be told, each day with intriguing details and interesting descriptions of the experience he was going through.

Five years ago, when I decided to write my first novel, images of this episode of my childhood resurfaced and enticed me to put down on paper this story that captivated me so much and left such an unforgettable mark on my imagination. This is how Salou and Benjamin, the main protagonists came to be, and the rest is history.

Today, after years of hard work, the novel is ready for publication. I trust that your contribution in this launching campaign, will make them riveting and memorable companions of your daily lives.

The story of Salou is above all a love story – against the backdrop of social and political unrest in Guinea, between two very special people facing down the trials life throw at them.

I hope you’ll enjoy and I thank you once again for your support in this journey.

story:
Five minutes, six, ten ... half an hour, an hour.

 No matter how much I try, no time, no video clip would be enough to squeeze all the magnitude of the mystery and the incredible beauty of emotions I experienced about 13 years ago. No time will be enough to tell you about 8 years of work on the book in which I have concealed a mystery ... Its the very beginning. The beginning of the mystery that could change everything. I believe that one dream, one incredible will, one incredibly strong feeling of a single person is able to change the world completely. Either destroy it once and for all, or save it and make it the most beautiful thing that can occur to a human mind, a place where everyone is happy regardless of what’s inside of one. This book, the first of three parts, tells about the mystery, which you've never heard of but which does exist in the real world. It is going to sweep over like a tsunami - hitting each and everyone - and there is no one to stop it. It shall spare no one and shall make all tremble at it’s might ...


The best and the most interesting story is always built around a mystery ...

The greater a mystery is, the less people know about it and the later it is revealed. Lines of many supposedly fictional stories hold the truth ... For this reason they decide themselves when they are destined to be born and surprise the whole world… for the greatest of them will be told in the end, to change everything.


It is time for you to open the door. The door which has these words written on it ... Abandon everything you knew, ye who enter here ...


Your destiny will never be the same again ... But what’s behind the door is worth abandoning the past forever.


Infinitely with all my heart, your Peter Cry


Chapters

The Black And White Photo

Dima wiped his face and head with a towel, put it on his shoulders, left the bathroom and came back into the bedroom.

-What was in the envelope?- he said, still drying out his hair.

-I did't open it.- said Catherine

-Why not?- said Dima surprised.

-I couldn't find anything sharp.- she said. -What if it is something important? I was afraid that I could damage it.-

-Catherine, how about tearing off the side carefully?- he said, jokingly. -Hasn't this idea crossed your beautiful model head?-

-Stop making fun of me,- she answered -And open it yourself, Einstein.-

Dima took the envelope, sat on the bed and opened it carefully. He put his hand inside and felt something that wasn’t a letter or flyer. He removed the content of the envelope and numbly stared at it.

-What’s wrong?- asked Catherine anxiously. -What is it?-

She snapped the message from his hands and held up an old black-and-white photograph. It captured an image of her beloved and another three men in an outdoor setting surrounded by trees.

The shot looked extremely unusual. The paper was timeworn and shabby as if it was very old, although Dima didn’t look much younger in the picture than he actually was. It was also unusual that all of them were darkly dressed, as if they were in deep mourning. At least it seemed so from the black-and-white color grade of the photograph. Dima looked satisfied and happy in the picture. He was smiling and hugging the people standing next to him.

-Honey, who are these men and why don’t I know them?- she asked.

-I have no idea- he replied.

-But you all look as though you know each other well.- she said.

-I do not know anyone in this picture.- said Dima as he took the photograph from her.

-You know what?- he continued absently while studying the photo. -I have never taken a picture like this. I have never worn these clothes. You know very well that I don’t like black. Nothing like this has ever happened to me. I am 100 per cent sure.-

Hall of Shadows

-That's it! - said the man in the darkness.

Usually, it meant that the meeting had come to an end. After a moment, somebody would pull a bag over the old man’s head and take him back. But this time, there was no hurry with the bag. The light was fading slowly.

-One more thing,- sounded the mysterious voice again. -You said that this could be a check and we are not the Shadows, that you have never seen our faces.-

Suddenly, a man stepped into the fading circle of light. He took a good look at his guest and continued.

-We decided to fill this gap in, especially since you are about to become one of us.- He held out his hand and said confidently. -My name is Jacques and I am the father of all Shadows not only in Paris, but in the whole of France.-

Marcus got it, there was no turning back. He was to become one of them, or die. After shaking hands, the German felt a cold and chill that ran through his entire body. The aristocratic man smiled, let go of the hand of the guest and faded away with the remains of light. For a moment, Marcus stayed in total darkness.

His tired eyes gradually became accustomed. Through the gloom he was able to see the silhouettes of the hall, as well as the people who were there. The German was amazed at the splendor and luxury, which had been hidden from his sight all the time. The huge, oval room, with extraordinary high ceilings majestically loomed over Marcus. Pillars in the middle of the spacious room supported the ceiling. They drew a circle of about fifteen to twenty meters which the German stood right in the middle of.

The black marble with white veins was the center piece of the pompous building. It seemed to be everywhere, from floor to ceiling. Polished to gloss, it reflected a dim yet soft and pleasant golden-orange light coming from old fireplace in the distance.

Marcus took a deep breath, once again enjoying the intoxicating scent, and then, having taken a look around, walked out of the circle and followed his new acquaintance by the name of Jacques. The latter, slowly, like a night moth headed to the source of light and warmth.

The German stopped abruptly. With the corner of his eye he noticed something on the walls. Coming closer, he froze.

He stood in front of a picture, huge and majestic, incredibly complex in its structure and performance, with lots of tiny details. The paintings were so beautiful that Marcus first thought they weren’t real. It seemed that it was either an image on a big ten by ten meters screen, holography or some sort of an illusion.

He approached to touch one of them and all his doubts were gone.The creation consisted of gold threads, precious stones, beads, oil paints, silk and other materials. Marcus went numb - not because of these wonders but rather of what was depicted in the picture.

Awe and servility overcame the German, looking at the details of sparkling canvas. It depicted a faceless man on his knees, holding a dying, incredibly beautiful blonde girl in his arms. Her face looked overwhelmingly innocent, like that of an angel. A faceless man shed tears over the bloodied body of the girl. The two were surrounded by an indifferent crowd that gazed at the young couple coldly and mercilessly.

The Frenchman came up to Marcus and handed him a glass of red wine. Taking a sip, the German quietly, almost whispering said, -Did it happen here?-

-Yes.- Jacques replied thoughtfully. -How did you know?-

-I heard about the story!- replied Marcus.

The host was clearly surprised by the answer.

-How?- he asked.

-Sometimes we had leaks of information from you.- Marcus said.

Staggered, Jacques tried to ask a question. The guest knew which question was about to come so he quickly interrupted.

-Do not ask me how. Even I, with all my powers there, do not know from where and how information arrives.-

The German, keeping his eyes on the work continued. -Is this that the man without a face?-

The Frenchman was reluctant to answer the question, but in order to avoid awkward silence, he just nodded his head.

-Do you smell the odor?- he said, trying to change the subject.

-Yes! - said Marcus. -I can smell it every time I come here, it is extremely strange and unusual. I always found it very interesting, but I’ve never dared to...-

The master interrupted, looked into Marcus’ eyes and said,

-This smell appeared at the time of her death. I remember everything as if it happened yesterday. After he picked her up from the floor and embraced her, the scent soared up, and filled the whole space of the hall. At that time, it was insanely strong. -

Jacques sipped some wine.

-The odor has been here for twelve years now.-

Marcus carefully interrupted his companion. -Special doors are there specifically to prevent the scent from disintegrating?-

Jacques grinned slightly. -No!-

-Then what are they for?- Marcus asked.

-Many of his close associates believe that her soul is still somewhere around and that someday she may be reborn anew. That's why the scent is still in here. It mysteriously reminds of itself, becoming a stronger or weaker from time to time. We are being told it is the smell of her soul. So lovely...-


Christopher and Dima Fight

The streets were empty and only occasional people stood in the shelters of the bus stops to wait for the capricious weather to get better. Christopher rested his head against the seat. Rain and grey skies always led to a predominantly peaceful mood which often made him sleepy. His eyes closed and drowsiness gradually dawned on him. He drifted off into a dream.

-Wake up.- said a man’s voice.

The words woke up the tired and sleepy American.

-Excuse me, what did you say?- He said drowsily.

The driver looked at him from the rear view mirror with surprise. -Me? I didn’t say a word. You must have misheard something.-

The young man shrugged his shoulders, yawned and looked out of the window.

Christopher’s eyes began to close again. He was definitely falling asleep this time. Suddenly, his eyes were drawn to a lonely young man sitting on the bench in the rain without an umbrella. It seemed rather peculiar so he focused his eyes to have a better look at the weirdo. What he saw made him shudder. Fear crept into

his heart. In a split second his drowsiness was gone. Overcoming his emotions the young man pulled himself together and shouted.

-STOP!!!-

The driver braked sharply thinking that he had failed to notice a pedestrian, but after taking a look around realized it was fine. Turning round to the back seat he asked. -What happened?-

The back seat was already empty but for a few banknotes. Wiping the foggy side window he found what he was looking for. His passenger stood outside the car door and shouted something while waving his hands.

Because of the grey veil of rain, Dima could not figure out what was going on, and he repeatedly failed to get a better look at the aggressive man. The noise of the rain and passing cars would not allow hearing the words that he was shouting.

-What? I don’t understand!- he shouted back.

Looking mad, the stranger dashed across the road in his direction. Noticing this unpleasant development, Dima put the picture back in his pocket, took a few steps backwards and prepared to defend himself.

On approach the angry words were getting audible.

-What the hell do you want from me!? What is it about? Tell me!!!-

The man came much closer and Dima managed to have a good look at him.

-What?- he whispered, surprised. -Christopher?-

His face twitched in an ugly evil grimace as he moved forward.

The two strong, athletic and well built men went to battle. Christopher sent his opponent to the ground with a left hook. Then he got on top of him and the two tumbled on the wet asphalt exchanging blows.

Dima managed to twist out of the steel constrains and kicked his opponent in the chin. It wasn’t strong but quite unpleasant. The man jumped away from him and fell to the ground a few steps away.

Dima got up quickly, wiped out his bleeding nose and took a few steps away from the spot of the fight.

-WHO ARE YOU???- – he shouted. -AND WHY… DO I KNOW YOUR NAME!?!?-

These words had no effect on Christopher and getting up he moved ahead obviously intending to continue the fight.

Christopher's Nightmare

Christopher turned his head back and rested it again on the cold ground.

-That’s the end…- he whispered. -Close your eyes and it will come to an end sooner.-

His eyelids were slowly closing.The surrounding fog suddenly began to disperse and weak outlines of the pavement began to emerge. The silhouette of an enormous building towered over him.

The change in the surroundings offered some strength to the man who was about to pass away.

The fog got thinner and thinner, and its dissolution seemed unusual and even strange. The white haze had gone up into the air like vapour sucked in by an air vent.

Christopher turned around slowly and discovered that he was laying in the middle of the huge crossroads. Along its sides stood grey skyscrapers. They looked awfully grim. There were no windows, and they consisted of pretty rough concrete blocks that seemed to be about to crash. Immense reinforcement rods, rusted and distorted, stuck out of concrete plates in every direction. The whole scene seemed hostile, dreadful and ominous. It was like the fantasy of some sick, perverted, maniac mind.

The young man pulled himself together and shouted at the top of his voice, -Help!!! Somebody help!!!-

So, without stopping and gasping for air, he continued for a few minutes. In response he heard only silence and the echo of his own voice.

From a distance came a rhythmic sound which grew louder and closer.

-Hooves!- it dawned on Christopher -This is the sound of hooves.-

Looking in the direction where the sound came from, he saw a big black horse approaching. It came up, lowered its head and tenderly touched the freezing man’s face with its huge, wet nose. The warm breath of the horse brought hope for deliverance from the frozen pale hell.

The unusual animal seemed familiar and it emitted incredible warmth.Sensing that, Christopher, still shivering, got up and strongly embraced its neck hoping to get a bit warmer.

-Nice boy…You are my nice boy- he repeated and nestled against the unexpected friend. In response, it obeyed and did not move, agreeably snorting from time to time.

-The Future- sounded hoarse old voice.

Christopher was startled and abruptly turned around, breaking his embrace, but there was no one in the direction where the voice came from.

-Your future!!!- shouted the voice which seemed to be getting closer.

He looked around again and was surprised to find an old man with long, grey hair and a beard. The old man was short and wore a light tunic. He carried a stick in his hand.

-Oh, God-. Thought Christopher when he saw man’s features.

The old man had white eyes, with no pupils and irises.

-Sorry, what?- he asked

-Your future- repeated the old man.

Confusion and fear made the young man squirm, and then he whispered as if a scared child, -I don’t understand…What about my future? What? What is going on here?! Where am I?-

All of a sudden, everything around him fell silent … the cold had gone…and the remnants of fog had gone away. The old man raised his hand and pointed at Christopher.

-Our future looks like soot, smells like smoke and sounds like the screams of a thousand people.- he said

Out of nowhere, breaking the silence, the roar of a siren came. Its sound was horrible, deafening, sickening, so terrible that both the old man’s and Christopher’s face twitched in agony. Vibrations emitted by the siren subdued the will and caused animal terror. Piercing the depths of consciousness and making every second unbearable.

Christopher, seeking salvation, covered his ears with hands. Raising his head up, he saw that the buildings were starting to collapse like houses of cards unable to resist the powerful vibration. Tremendous, grey, stony pieces were violently falling down and landing with thunder, breaking the asphalt.

A block of concrete separated from the building sheltering Christopher and fell down toward him. He just helplessly looked up at his inevitably approaching death. He held his head in his hands and fell to his knees.

Once members of the team, each a professional in a particular field, read and learned about the mystery behind the story and believed in the novel. They have been doing their job with high quality and great love to a reader, a listener and a viewer. Driven by a dream and faith in the future, with no rewards in the process, they do their best. Author of the book, Peter Cry, found these people in their professional fields and after reading the synopsis they agreed to participate in the birth of the book or, rather, a franchise - a huge world, where you will encounter boundless, mysterious and captivating events.


Where will the money go?

-audio book


-fully-featured interactive application for tablets and smartphones (puzzles, riddles, hidden codes, spin-offs, videos)


-book trailers

Perks




And many more...

 Full TV and Internet series, with professional actors.


A series, consisting of 10-12 episodes will reveal no less secrets existing in the real world than the book itself, and will smoothly guide you to the beginning of the novel (prequel). The story and the movie will surprise you with high quality, and most importantly, content: a plot that will never leave you indifferent and spark an urge to demand the continuation of the story.

Five minutes, six, ten ... half an hour, an hour.
 No matter how much I try, no time, no video clip would be enough to squeeze all the magnitude of the mystery and the incredible beauty of emotions I experienced about 13 years ago. No time will be enough to tell you about 8 years of work on the book in which I have concealed a mystery ... Its the very beginning. The beginning of the mystery that could change everything. I believe that one dream, one incredible will, one incredibly strong feeling of a single person is able to change the world completely. Either destroy it once and for all, or save it and make it the most beautiful thing that can occur to a human mind, a place where everyone is happy regardless of what’s inside of one. This book, the first of three parts, tells about the mystery, which you've never heard of but which does exist in the real world. It is going to sweep over like a tsunami - hitting each and everyone - and there is no one to stop it. It shall spare no one and shall make all tremble at it’s might ...


The best and the most interesting story is always built around a mystery ... 

The greater a mystery is, the less people know about it and the later it is revealed. Lines of many supposedly fictional stories hold the truth ... For this reason they decide themselves when they are destined to be born and surprise the whole world… for the greatest of them will be told in the end, to change everything.

It is time for you to open the door. The door which has these words written on it ... Abandon everything you knew, ye who enter here ...


Your destiny will never be the same again ... But what’s behind the door is worth abandoning the past forever.


Infinitely with all my heart, your Peter Cry





Chapters


The Black And White Photo



Dima wiped his face and head with a towel, put it on his
shoulders, left the bathroom and came back into the bedroom.
-What
was in the envelope?-
he said, still drying out his hair.
-I
did't open it.- said
Catherine

-Why
not?- said Dima
surprised.

-I
couldn't find anything sharp.-
she said. -What if it
is something important? I was afraid that I could damage it.-

-Catherine,
how about tearing off the side carefully?- he said, jokingly. -Hasn't this idea crossed your beautiful model head?-

-Stop
making fun of me,- she
answered -And open it
yourself, Einstein.-

Dima took the envelope, sat on the bed and opened it
carefully. He put his hand inside and felt something that wasn’t a letter or
flyer. He removed the content of the envelope and numbly stared at it. 

-What’s
wrong?- asked Catherine
anxiously. -What is it?-

She snapped the message from his hands and held up an old
black-and-white photograph. It captured an image of her beloved and another
three men in an outdoor setting surrounded by trees. 

The shot looked extremely unusual. The paper was timeworn
and shabby as if it was very old, although Dima didn’t look much younger in the
picture than he actually was. It was also unusual that all of them were darkly
dressed, as if they were in deep mourning. At least it seemed so from the
black-and-white color grade of the photograph. Dima looked satisfied and happy
in the picture. He was smiling and hugging the people standing next to him.

-Honey,
who are these men and why don’t I know them?- she asked.

-I
have no idea- he
replied. 

-But
you all look as though you know each other well.- she said. 

-I
do not know anyone in this picture.- said Dima as he took the photograph from her. 

-You
know what?- he
continued absently while studying the photo. -I have never taken a picture like this. I have never worn these
clothes. You know very well that I don’t like black. Nothing like this has ever
happened to me. I am 100 per cent sure.-
Hall of Shadows

-That's
it! - said the man in the darkness.

Usually, it meant that the meeting had come to an end. After
a moment, somebody would pull a bag over the old man’s head and take him back.
But this time, there was no hurry with the bag. The light was fading slowly. 

-One
more thing,- sounded
the mysterious voice again. -You
said that this could be a check and we are not the Shadows, that you have never
seen our faces.-

Suddenly, a man stepped into the fading circle of light. He
took a good look at his guest and continued. 

-We
decided to fill this gap in, especially since you are about to become one of us.- He held out his hand and
said confidently. -My
name is Jacques and I am the father of all Shadows not only in Paris, but in
the whole of France.-

Marcus got it, there was no turning back. He was to become
one of them, or die. After shaking hands, the German felt a cold and chill that
ran through his entire body. The aristocratic man smiled, let go of the hand of
the guest and faded away with the remains of light. For a moment, Marcus stayed
in total darkness.

His tired eyes gradually became accustomed. Through the
gloom he was able to see the silhouettes of the hall, as well as the people who
were there. The German was amazed at the splendor and luxury, which had been
hidden from his sight all the time. The huge, oval room, with extraordinary
high ceilings majestically loomed over Marcus. Pillars in the middle of the
spacious room supported the ceiling. They drew a circle of about fifteen to
twenty meters which the German stood right in the middle of.

The black marble with white veins was the center piece of
the pompous building. It seemed to be everywhere, from floor to ceiling.
Polished to gloss, it reflected a dim yet soft and pleasant golden-orange light
coming from old fireplace in the distance. 

Marcus took a deep breath, once again enjoying the
intoxicating scent, and then, having taken a look around, walked out of the
circle and followed his new acquaintance by the name of Jacques. The latter,
slowly, like a night moth headed to the source of light and warmth.

The German stopped abruptly. With the corner of his eye he
noticed something on the walls. Coming closer, he froze.

He stood in front of a picture, huge and majestic,
incredibly complex in its structure and performance, with lots of tiny details.
The paintings were so beautiful that Marcus first thought they weren’t real. It
seemed that it was either an image on a big ten by ten meters screen,
holography or some sort of an illusion.

He approached to touch one of them and all his doubts were
gone.The creation consisted of gold threads, precious stones, beads, oil
paints, silk and other materials. Marcus went numb - not because of these
wonders but rather of what was depicted in the picture.

Awe and servility overcame the German, looking at the
details of sparkling canvas. It depicted a faceless man on his knees, holding a
dying, incredibly beautiful blonde girl in his arms. Her face looked
overwhelmingly innocent, like that of an angel. A faceless man shed tears over
the bloodied body of the girl. The two were surrounded by an indifferent crowd
that gazed at the young couple coldly and mercilessly.

The Frenchman came up to Marcus and handed him a glass of
red wine. Taking a sip, the German quietly, almost whispering said, -Did it happen here?-

-Yes.- Jacques replied
thoughtfully. -How did
you know?-

-I
heard about the story!-
replied Marcus.

The host was clearly surprised by the answer. 

-How?- he asked.

-Sometimes
we had leaks of information from you.- Marcus said. 

Staggered, Jacques tried to ask a question. The guest knew
which question was about to come so he quickly interrupted.

-Do
not ask me how. Even I, with all my powers there, do not know from where and
how information arrives.-

The German, keeping his eyes on the work continued. -Is this that the man without a face?-

The Frenchman was reluctant to answer the question, but in
order to avoid awkward silence, he just nodded his head.

-Do
you smell the odor?- he
said, trying to change the subject.

-Yes!
- said Marcus. -I can
smell it every time I come here, it is extremely strange and unusual. I always
found it very interesting, but I’ve never dared to...-

The master interrupted, looked into Marcus’ eyes and said, 

-This
smell appeared at the time of her death. I remember everything as if it
happened yesterday. After he picked her up from the floor and embraced her, the
scent soared up, and filled the whole space of the hall. At that time, it was
insanely strong. - 

Jacques sipped some wine.

-The
odor has been here for twelve years now.-

Marcus carefully interrupted his companion. -Special doors are there
specifically to prevent the scent from disintegrating?-

Jacques grinned slightly. -No!-

-Then
what are they for?-
Marcus asked. 

-Many
of his close associates believe that her soul is still somewhere around and
that someday she may be reborn anew. That's why the scent is still in here. It
mysteriously reminds of itself, becoming a stronger or weaker from time to
time. We are being told it is the smell of her soul. So lovely...-




Christopher and Dima Fight



The streets were empty and only occasional people stood in
the shelters of the bus stops to wait for the capricious weather to get better.
Christopher rested his head against the seat. Rain and grey skies always led to
a predominantly peaceful mood which often made him sleepy. His eyes closed and
drowsiness gradually dawned on him. He drifted off into a dream. 

-Wake
up.- said a man’s
voice.

The words woke up the tired and sleepy American.

-Excuse
me, what did you say?-
He said drowsily. 

The driver looked at him from the rear view mirror with
surprise. -Me? I didn’t
say a word. You must have misheard something.-

The young man shrugged his shoulders, yawned and looked out
of the window. 

Christopher’s eyes began to close again. He was definitely
falling asleep this time. Suddenly, his eyes were drawn to a lonely young man
sitting on the bench in the rain without an umbrella. It seemed rather peculiar
so he focused his eyes to have a better look at the weirdo. What he saw made
him shudder. Fear crept into

his heart. In a split second his drowsiness was gone.
Overcoming his emotions the young man pulled himself together and shouted.

-STOP!!!-

The driver braked sharply thinking that he had failed to
notice a pedestrian, but after taking a look around realized it was fine.
Turning round to the back seat he asked. -What happened?-

The back seat was already empty but for a few banknotes.
Wiping the foggy side window he found what he was looking for. His passenger
stood outside the car door and shouted something while waving his hands.

Because of the grey veil of rain, Dima could not figure out
what was going on, and he repeatedly failed to get a better look at the
aggressive man. The noise of the rain and passing cars would not allow hearing
the words that he was shouting. 

-What?
I don’t understand!- he
shouted back.

Looking mad, the stranger dashed across the road in his
direction. Noticing this unpleasant development, Dima put the picture back in
his pocket, took a few steps backwards and prepared to defend himself.

On approach the angry words were getting audible.

-What
the hell do you want from me!? What is it about? Tell me!!!-

The man came much closer and Dima managed to have a good look
at him.

-What?- he whispered, surprised. -Christopher?-

His face twitched in an ugly evil grimace as he moved
forward.

The two strong, athletic and well built men went to battle.
Christopher sent his opponent to the ground with a left hook. Then he got on
top of him and the two tumbled on the wet asphalt exchanging blows.

Dima managed to twist out of the steel constrains and kicked
his opponent in the chin. It wasn’t strong but quite unpleasant. The man jumped
away from him and fell to the ground a few steps away.

Dima got up quickly, wiped out his bleeding nose and took a
few steps away from the spot of the fight. 

-WHO
ARE YOU???- – he
shouted. -AND WHY… DO I
KNOW YOUR NAME!?!?-

These words had no effect on Christopher and getting up he
moved ahead obviously intending to continue the fight.

Christopher's Nightmare

Christopher turned his head back and rested it again on the
cold ground.

-That’s
the end…- he whispered.
-Close your eyes and it
will come to an end sooner.-

His eyelids were slowly closing.The surrounding fog suddenly
began to disperse and weak outlines of the pavement began to emerge. The
silhouette of an enormous building towered over him. 

The change in the surroundings offered some strength to the
man who was about to pass away.

The fog got thinner and thinner, and its dissolution seemed
unusual and even strange. The white haze had gone up into the air like vapour
sucked in by an air vent. 

Christopher turned around slowly and discovered that he was
laying in the middle of the huge crossroads. Along its sides stood grey
skyscrapers. They looked awfully grim. There were no windows, and they
consisted of pretty rough concrete blocks that seemed to be about to crash.
Immense reinforcement rods, rusted and distorted, stuck out of concrete plates
in every direction. The whole scene seemed hostile, dreadful and ominous. It
was like the fantasy of some sick, perverted, maniac mind.

The young man pulled himself together and shouted at the top
of his voice, -Help!!!
Somebody help!!!-

So, without stopping and gasping for air, he continued for a
few minutes. In response he heard only silence and the echo of his own voice.

From a distance came a rhythmic sound which grew louder and
closer.

-Hooves!- it dawned on Christopher -This is the sound of hooves.-

Looking in the direction where the sound came from, he saw a
big black horse approaching. It came up, lowered its head and tenderly touched
the freezing man’s face with its huge, wet nose. The warm breath of the horse
brought hope for deliverance from the frozen pale hell.

The unusual animal seemed familiar and it emitted incredible
warmth.Sensing that, Christopher, still shivering, got up and strongly embraced
its neck hoping to get a bit warmer. 

-Nice
boy…You are my nice boy-
he repeated and nestled against the unexpected friend. In response, it obeyed
and did not move, agreeably snorting from time to time.

-The
Future- sounded hoarse
old voice. 

Christopher was startled and abruptly turned around,
breaking his embrace, but there was no one in the direction where the voice
came from.

-Your
future!!!- shouted the
voice which seemed to be getting closer.

He looked around again and was surprised to find an old man
with long, grey hair and a beard. The old man was short and wore a light tunic.
He carried a stick in his hand.

-Oh,
God-. Thought
Christopher when he saw man’s features.

The old man had white eyes, with no pupils and irises.

-Sorry,
what?- he asked

-Your
future- repeated the
old man. 

Confusion and fear made the young man squirm, and then he whispered
as if a scared child, -I
don’t understand…What about my future? What? What is going on here?! Where am
I?-

All of a sudden, everything around him fell silent … the
cold had gone…and the remnants of fog had gone away. The old man raised his
hand and pointed at Christopher.

-Our
future looks like soot, smells like smoke and sounds like the screams of a
thousand people.- he
said 

Out of nowhere, breaking the silence, the roar of a siren
came. Its sound was horrible, deafening, sickening, so terrible that both the

siren subdued the will and caused animal terror. Piercing the depths of

Raising his head up, he saw that the buildings were starting to collapse like

asphalt.

story:
"So far as I am able to judge, nothing has been left undone, either by man or nature, to make India the most extraordinary country that the sun visits on his rounds. Nothing seems to have been forgotten, nothing overlooked."

Mark Twain
American Writer

 

India, like any other nation, has seen various ups and downs in the due course of its history.

 

Much before we get to the point of discussing on why India at seventy-one and why this book; Do take a moment to contemplate as to why should you be concerned to get into the intricacies of the book?

We are often disturbed when we see students or young Indians complain about the country without appreciating the fact how we have grown in the past few years. 

We have been in India for more than twenty years, now.

We have seen the diversity of the country, experienced the cosmopolitan culture, encountered the life of rural India experientially and have been judged on being boys from a ‘developing nation’ on the face of the planet.

But losing our roots by following the shimmering 'cool culture' has not been our story rather we have remained grounded to our personal and professional life realities. Like a majority of you, we have always believed in finding our way out, but never by luck.

It is really not about praising ourselves, but being honest about our opinions. Both of us are on a mission to add value to people’s lives in whatever we do. And of course, grow as sensible considerate humans, in our endeavors.

 

Education has taught us to be in sync with our motives in life and hard-work has reaffirmed the thought process we carry. We are proud of being born as a Gen-Y in India;

1. We have seen the shift from using the Nokia 3300 to the not so common Vertu.

2. A shift from when air conditioners used to be a luxury till when every cab even had an air conditioner with WiFi.

3. From paying exorbitant prices for international calling to calling friends overseas any moment using Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP), we have seen our country go through a paradigm shift, and that’s why our opinions matter.

4. And counting . .

Our opinion has been cast by our experience and the way the country has morphed in the past seventy-one years. And we, as young citizens of this country get to decide the coming years and the way India ‘castes itself’ and hence, the opinion matters.

 

Before we move ahead into more serious stuff, we would like to take a quick moment and briefly tell our readers the story behind this book and more importantly, why it means a lot to both of us.

__

Rohan throughout his twenty-three years of life has been looking for options to give back to the society (in tandem to his professional and academic pursuits) whether it was through planting a few trees in his neighborhood or doing something meaningful on a big stage. Through his work in the year long student integration programs at Google and Facebook, he has paved way for some budding businesses, internet strategies, and liaising projects in Technology and Management sphere in India.

In tandem, Rohan has been a big fan of independently organized TED events (TEDx) since the time he watched TED videos when he was in the eighth grade and wanted to organize one of his own which was later realized to be in collaboration with Nehha Bhatnagar, the renowned Bharatanatyam Dancer and the youngest arts impresario in India; Who also happened to be the licensee of TEDxTughlaqRd (Delhi’s biggest and India’s second biggest TEDx event). Soon, both of them collaborated and started organizing TEDxTughlaqRd 2016 edition.

 

On the other hand, Dhruv who is always in search of new and exciting avenues was still completing his engineering second year at Delhi Technological University (formerly Delhi College of Engineering) saw one of his friends put up a status on Facebook that she was volunteering at TEDxTughlaqRd. Without a clear conviction, he searched the website of TEDxTughlaqRd and noticed Nehha who he already had met a few times in the past year at different editions of an experiential workshop popularly known as Young India Challenge.

By now, Rohan had already committed his time to TEDxTughlaqRd as the Program Manager. Soon, Dhruv joined as the Head of Technology. Since then, both worked day and night and left no stone unturned to make the event a success. As one might expect, the duo also faced several ups and downs but their bond has strengthened day by day.

One fine day, Rohan who worked nearby to Dhruv’s place was visiting Dhruv for breakfast to discuss and finalize the publishers for his first book titled ‘Celebrating Failure’. After an in-depth discussion on the same, Dhruv told Rohan that he had an idea for another book where he wanted to get people together to write an anthology. Rohan told Dhruv that the idea was amazing but still needed to be polished enough. Dhruv, in turn, asked for Rohan’s help for the same, as usual, and later both of them decided to once again merge their forces to build yet another unique experience for their admirers.

 

Both Dhruv and Rohan have always tried to add some value to people’s life in tandem to personal academic pursuits, give back to the society and always create an environment for people around them to grow with them. And this book, (I.N.D.I.A.)71, is the outcome of the same.

 

(I.N.D.I.A.)71 is a project initiated to give a voice to handpicked seventy-one Indian citizens from all walks of life on what they feel and perceive about India as a country – past, present and future.

 

#India71
