Soon, both of them collaborated and started organizing TEDxTughlaqRd 2016 edition. On the other hand, Dhruv who is always in search of new and exciting avenues was still completing his engineering second year at Delhi Technological University (formerly Delhi College of Engineering) saw one of his friends put up a status on Facebook that she was volunteering at TEDxTughlaqRd. Without a clear conviction, he searched the website of TEDxTughlaqRd and noticed Nehha who he already had met a few times in the past year at different editions of an experiential workshop popularly known as Young India Challenge.By now, Rohan had already committed his time to TEDxTughlaqRd as the Program Manager. Soon, Dhruv joined as the Head of Technology. Since then, both worked day and night and left no stone unturned to make the event a success. As one might expect, the duo also faced several ups and downs but their bond has strengthened day by day.One fine day, Rohan who worked nearby to Dhruv’s place was visiting Dhruv for breakfast to discuss and finalize the publishers for his first book titled ‘Celebrating Failure’. After an in-depth discussion on the same, Dhruv told Rohan that he had an idea for another book where he wanted to get people together to write an anthology. Rohan told Dhruv that the idea was amazing but still needed to be polished enough. Dhruv, in turn, asked for Rohan’s help for the same, as usual, and later both of them decided to once again merge their forces to build yet another unique experience for their admirers. Both Dhruv and Rohan have always tried to add some value to people’s life in tandem to personal academic pursuits, give back to the society and always create an environment for people around them to grow with them. And this book, (I.N.D.I.A.)71, is the outcome of the same. (I.N.D.I.A.)71 is a project initiated to give a voice to handpicked seventy-one Indian citizens from all walks of life on what they feel and perceive about India as a country – past, present and future. #India71

story:
My twin sons, Michael and Daniel, were born with the aid of a surrogate mother in India, in April 2012. I raise them on my own. When I decided to become a father, they became my first priority. My writing is second, my personal life is next.

A Writing Father-Mother

I call myself 'a writing mother', because that's what I am - a single gay father-mother of two boys, who need me daily. I clean and cook, I do laundry and take care of our dog and cats and garden, and basically do everything on my own. Since I have to support my kids financially I teach between 6-8 writing courses in a semester, and edit 1-3 books a month. This makes writing almost impossible.

My Future projects

I am now in the process writing 3 new novels. One is half written. It is a novel that takes place during the Renaissance. The second is partly written, and it deals with a Jewish historical figure of the 17th century. The third novel is under research, and its protagonist is a Jewish woman who is also an historical figure from the 16th century.
I need more time to turn my last three novels into scripts for the cinema and television international market.

My mission

As a Jewish gay writer and activist, one of the first gay men who went out of the closet, back in the 1980's, my mission is to re-invent Judaism in a subversive way. I implant homosexuality in the history of the Jewish nation, where it was silenced for centuries, and impose subjective or imaginary memory on the collective memory of the Jewish nation. I need writing time for my next three novels and time to turn my best-sellers into scripts for the TV and cinema international market. By supporting my writing, you will help me change the Israeli society, or at least help a single gay writing Mom-Dad go back to his desk.

I need 72,000 $ because this is my yearly budget. As much as I will get will enable me to save my working hours for writing, reduce my teaching and editing hours, without harming my parenting time.

My free time is only while my kids are in the kindergurten, between 08.00 am-16.00 pm. But this slot of time goes first to earning money, cleaning, doing laundry, cooking, attending our dog and two cats, gardening, etc. At nights I read my students writing asyngements. This is the reason that those days I write only during my own courses, while my students are writing too. This is impossible. 

My main perk for you is my best-seller 'A Tale of a Ring' in English. A Tale of A Ring is a fascinating page-turner based on the real historical events wich took place in Argentina and East-Europe between the years 1870-1930. An organization of Jewish pimps by the name of Tzvi Migdal persuaded Jewish families in Poland and Lithuania to entrust it with their daughters, promising to marry them to Jewish husbands or find them domestic work in Jewish homes in Buenos Aires. These girls fell victim to a sophisticated underground network that enslaved them for the rest of their lives, with the support and collaboration of the local police and the government.

The Jewish community fought with all their might against these pimp and their supporting partners, which were called “Las Impuros” - The Unclean. The same caused the affair to be silenced and repressed from the collective memory of the Jewish community. Now, for the first time, the historical truth is revealed, in a well-researched and fascinating novel that became an Israeli best seller, selling over 80,000 copies since its publication in 2007.

I also offer you an un-printed poem of mine or a collection of my poems in word document, translated into English. My higher perks makes you a creative partners of mine - by thanking you in my next novel, or by giving a writing instruction or lecture to a person or a group in Israel according to your choice.

By helping me meet my target you will enable me to write three novels this year. One is half written. It is a novel that takes place during the Renaissance. The second is partly written, and it deals with a Jewish historical figure of the 17th century. The third novel is under research, and its protagonist is a Jewish woman who is also an historical figure from the 16th century.

But any sum I will get will entitle me with some hours of writing. Any dollar you give buys me some time for writing. I bless you for that. Since I started to publish my works, in the early 1980's, I helped many Israeli GLBT to find their queer identity. Your contribution will make it happen deeper and faster.

S. Daniel Breslauer wrote, in his book "Creating a Judaism Without Religion: A Postmodern Jewish Possibility": "The young Israeli poet, Ilan Sheinfeld, has offered powerful writings that seduce the reader into an experience that alters ones sense of self. Sheinfeld uses words for performative purposes. To speak or write a word, to read or to hear it, is to experience a reality [...] Sheinfeld has been a pioneer in gay literature in Israel, and his poems provide a vital experience that draws the reader into the feelings and emotions of love."

Caryn S. Aviv, ‎David Shneer write, in their book "New Jews: The End of the Jewish Diaspora": "The gay Israeli poet, Ilan Sheinfeld, in his poem 'my Identity', adds that, at least for queer Jewish Israelis, travel is a source of identity formation."

Lee Walzer, in his book "Between Sodom and Eden: A Gay Journey Through Today's Changing Israel" wrote: "What I found was a very bright, personable, and engaging man. What most impressed my about him was that he was engaged with his Judaism in a way few secular Israelis would admit today. Judaism for him was not a topic in which he engaged separate from the rest of his life. Rather, he had a constant internal dialogue going between his Judaism and his homosexuality. Add to that the power and richness of his Hebrew and the hot gay erotic poetry he composes in the ancient\modern language and you have a central cultural figure."

Dear friends, you will not spend your money in vein here. But if you can not contribute money, you can help me by sharing this page on your social media and spread the news where ever you wish - in the media, in your LGBT group or in your synagogue. Please feel free to to do that.

Please feel free to go into my English blog at https://thegaymomdad.wordpress.com. If you read Hebrew, you are mostly invited to my blog, at https://ilansheinfeld.wordpress.com/, where I write daily about my experience as a single gay Israeli father.

Thank you in advance,

yours,

Ilan Sheinfeld,

Israel.

story:
Resumen

 

Los colaboradores financian ideas que los apasionan y a la gente en la que confían. Estas son algunas cosas que puedes hacer en esta sección:

 
  •  Queremos incentivar la inteligencia emocional y creativo a los niños, con aventuras simpáticas y sobre todo con ilustraciones perfectas para que los niños estén inmersos en ellos.
     
  • Preséntate y cuenta tu historia.
    Me llamo Francisca Gaete Trautmann, soy de profesión Periodista, pero me he desempeñado como Community Manager y Asistente. Amo leer y desde los 7 años que deseo sacar un libro.
    Mañitas es una ilustradora con gran potencial que pueden ver en: https://www.facebook.com/Manitasoficial. Tiene un espíritu juvenil y capta lo que los niños quieren.
  • Describe brevemente tu campaña y explica por qué es importante para ti.Para mi Titili y Chanchisca quieren su libro es una especie de sueño que siempre he querido cumplir. Siempre he escrito, pero este año con 31 años determine hacerlo. Y aquí estoy, creando. 
  • Expresa la magnitud de lo que logrará la ayuda de los colaboradores.
    Sería un enorme aporte, una generosidad y aprendizaje para los niños. Yo me inspiré en los niños del Hospital Felix Bulnes, y me dio la fuerza de hacer este libro. No se arrepentirán, es divertido y las ilustraciones son hermosas.
 

Recuerda, sé breve pero personal. Pregúntate: si alguien dejara de leer aquí, ¿estaría listo para colaborar?

 Eso no lo sé.

 

 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

 

Presenta más detalles:

 
  •  
  • explica cuánto financiamiento necesitas y a dónde va. Sé transparente y específico, la gente necesita confiar en ti para que quiera financiarte.

    La plata va ,para pagar los gastos para hacer el libro. No es un mega medio libro, y con lo recaudado podríamos sacarlo.
  • Cuéntale a la gente sobre tus recompensas exclusivas. ¡Haz que se entusiasmen!
  •  
  • Describe a dónde van los fondos si no logras la meta total.
  •  Entre la ilustradora y para mi, para juntar nuevamente y empezar de nuevo.
 

 

 

El impacto

 

Explica tu campaña en mayor detalle y cuéntale a la gente la diferencia que hará su contribución:

 Es un cuento de 2 mejores amigas. Es un sol (Titili) y un perro koala (Chanchisca). Les va muy bien en el colegio, lo pasan chancho y se ríen como si nunca malo pasará. Crearon una banda y ahí comienzan sus aventuras.
  •  
  • explica por qué tu proyecto es valioso para el colaborador y para el mundo.

Queremos transmitir ilustraciones lindas y valores desde pequeños a los niños.

  •  
  • Describe tu historial de éxito en proyectos como este (si lo tienes).
  • No, puros comentarios positivos, pero de dos personas, he sido reservada con el libro.
  •  
  • Haz que la gente lo sienta real y genera confianza.
  • Si, las do personas la encontraron divertida y con los puntos que puse en el cuento (valores),
  •  
 

 

 

Riesgos y desafíos

 

Las personas valoran la transparencia. Sé abierto y destácate al ofrecer perspectivas sobre los riesgos y obstáculos que puedes enfrentar en el camino hacia lograr tu meta.

 
  •  
  • Comparte lo que hace que te destaques para superar estos obstáculos.
  • Los valores y incentivar la literatura a los niños desde chicos.
  •  
  • Describe tu plan para solucionar estos desafíos.

Seguir buscando oportunidades, no dejarme caer.

  •  
 

 

 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

 

Algunas personas no pueden colaborar, pero eso no significa que no puedan ayudar:

 
  •  
  • pídele a la gente que difunda tu campaña y que genere eco.

Podría pedir que se saque fotos, hacer videos

  •  
  • Recuérdales que usen las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo.
  •  
 

 

Y eso es todo.

story:
We would like to talk to you about our "Folding Stick", a project that started about a year ago and is almost completed.

This idea originated one day watching our five year old son: he was playing with some colourful wooden sticks and started creating shapes with them. We can say, that was his first project!!

Folding Stick is an educational game. It is simple to use, but it can really affect positively children’s learning abilities. Nonetheless, it is an unexpected anti stress for grown ups.....

 

This project is made of colourful plastic sticks put together and folding. It also comes with a book that contains letters of the alphabet so the children can use the sticks to create back the letters.

The book’s artwork is very simple, in order not to distract the child while he concentrates on the letters.

We have noticed that with this method "Create and learn" children learn quicker and memorize the letters more effectively.

With Folding Stick you can play together with your son: you can create and guess the shape of the letters.

It is our intention to have a YouTube channel where we'll upload the children creations made with the Folding Stick.

The creation that will receive the higher number of votes will be awarded with a scholarship.

Folding Stick is fully made in Italy, with guaranteed and controlled non-toxic materials.

The book will be translated into English, Spanish and Italian.

 

Hoping to have contributed to our children's learning, we do hope to receive help from all of you in order to make this dream become reality.

VIDEO IS ALSO AVAILABLE IN SPANISH AND ITALIAN LANGUAGE ON THE YOUTUBE CHANNEL. SEARCH: Metroforma \ Folding Stick

We warmly thank you. And remember: "Create and Learn"!

SWITCH YOUR BRAIN ON!!!

Ciao! I am Davide

and I regard myself as a creative talent. I was born in 1977 and I have always been into anything that inspires me creativity. My stage name is Dado Manero, a name that was stitched up by my colleagues of an advertising firm where I was used to work. I have been painting and carving sculptures since I was a boy and from there started my interest into inventions. I really like creating new objects and also improving exhisting ones for a better daily life.

My love for art and colours is the main feature of my character and I tend to involve in my passion the people of my family and around me. One of the projects I created is the Alphabet Folding Stick.

I got the idea one day watching my son playing with colourful wooden sticks.

As it is in my natural inclination, I decided to improve this instrument in order to make it more interactive and straightforward.

When I first gave my son the prototype of the Alphabet, he immediately started playing with it and guessing the shapes of the letters.

In only a few days he finished the book, with all its letters and the numbers included.

I also tested the toy on a friend’s daughter, in order to understand its effectiveness and I could see that the girl had the same outcome as my son: she quickly learnt all the letters and showed to be able to recreate them even without the Alphabet.

That meant that she had already intaken all the shapes and could recall their name without aids. This is how I understood that “doing is learning”.

After that, i decided to play the game over dinner with friends and their sons. We played together and the children were crying cheerfully repeating the shapes of the letters and guessing their correct name.

That was a wonderful night and a very funny one! From that occasion an idea came up to create an award for children using the Alphabet Folding Sticks: your children can create letters using one or more Folding sticks without the guidance of the parents, or if necessary, the least possibile help in order to incentivize the children’s creativity.

You can send the videos to the mailbox of the Folding sticks and they will be uploaded on a proper related YouTube channel. The child whose video will receive the higher number of visualisations, along with a high mark of a pedagogist that will watch all uploadings, will receive a scolarship.

The logo is inspired by a Vulcan salute. The Vulcan salute here shown has a mean if for each finger. Tai nasha no karosha =Live long and prosper.

The pinky finger represents the "idic philosophy=infinte differences in infinite combinations. The ring finger represents the philosophy of the name(everything).

The middle finger,which is the longest,represents the teaching of logica and emotion. The index finger represents the Vulcan respect for life and held together with the middle finger it means we are always learning about life and emotion.

The thumb on its own represents the importance of each individual and his privacy.

The use of this salute with its ritual words means we acknowledge others their mental privacy and their right to be different.We also invite them to combine with the worlds differences.

That meant that she had already intaken all the shapes and could recall their name without aids. This is how I understood that “doing is learning”.
After that, i decided to play the game over dinner with friends and their sons. We played together and the children were crying cheerfully repeating the shapes of the letters and guessing their correct name.
That was a wonderful night and a very funny one! From that occasion an idea came up to create an award for children using the Alphabet Folding Sticks: your children can create letters using one or more Folding sticks without the guidance of the parents, or if necessary, the least possibile help in order to incentivize the children’s creativity.
You can send the videos to the mailbox of the Folding sticks and they will be uploaded on a proper related YouTube channel. The child whose video will receive the higher number of visualisations, along with a high mark of a pedagogist that will watch all uploadings, will receive a scolarship.
The logo is inspired by a Vulcan salute. The Vulcan salute here shown has a mean if for each finger. Tai nasha no karosha =Live long and prosper.
The pinky finger represents the "idic philosophy=infinte differences in infinite combinations. The ring finger represents the philosophy of the name(everything).
The middle finger,which is the longest,represents the teaching of logica and emotion. The index finger represents the Vulcan respect for life and held together with the middle finger it means we are always learning about life and emotion.
The thumb on its own represents the importance of each individual and his privacy.
The use of this salute with its ritual words means we acknowledge others their mental privacy and their right to be different.We also invite them to combine with the worlds differences.

Do writers need their own website builder?

We asked around, and we got a whopping reply of YES. Seems like the current tools are too complicated, or too generic, or too expensive, or created with something completely different in mind. Sounds familiar? If so, you're in the same boat as the many writers we've interviewed.

Writers (like you and us) need a better solution. We need a builder that cuts down on the effort, frustration, and time it takes to put together a professional website.

That's why we've come up with Readership Pro, the ultimate website builder for writers, with the best of all worlds:

  • Simple
  • Time-saving
  • Gorgeous
  • Affordable

Readership Pro is designed with two parts: wizard forms and free-form pages.

Wizard forms will allow you to enter information about your books, series, reviews, awards, and much more. They take this information and transform it into beautiful, formatted, and consistent pages.

These forms will also save you the need to enter information more than once. For example, let's say you've received a 5-star review on your book. Congratulations! You'll want to boast this review on the book page, on your Reviews page, and perhaps even on the front page. With our wizard forms, you will only have to fill in a single "Review" form, and the information will appear everywhere it needs to be. It's that simple!

But simplicity is not everything. You're a creative person, and people like you and us need the freedom to create, too. That's why the second half of Readership Pro is free-form pages. Think of these as a wide canvas on which you can paint with our selection of tools (a.k.a. widgets). You can add an image widget, a text widget, a divider, and more, position them however you like, and enter whatever content you need.

Here's a mockup of how the free-form section will look:


Wizard forms and free-form pages are a powerful combination that will let you create a professional website at one tenth of the usual time.

We put together an awesome list of perks to help you back this project. Choose whatever works for you best! And remember, you can always mix-and-match more than one perk.

There are five types of perks you can choose from.

Membership Perks

Be the first to use Readership Pro with a full membership:

Do It For Me Perks

Our interface will be simple and intuitive. Still hesitant? Don't have the time? No worries! We'll enter all of your information for you and hand you the keys to your complete website. NOTE: please also choose a membership perk, otherwise you won't be able to enjoy your new website.

Theme Perks

Readership Pro will come with a rich collection of themes. Want to make sure there's one that's just right for you? Check out these perks:

Extra Perks

Check out this awesome collection of writing goodies. Feel free to snag more than one!

Publisher Perks

Heads up, publishers! Huge discounts on empowering your authors to reach more readers. These packages are for 12 months of membership for each user. Plus, you'll be mentioned on the FRONT PAGE of Readership Pro as a supporting publisher. Check out your options:

Meet the team behind Readership Pro:

YOU! If you've read this far, then writing must be flowing in your veins. Readership Pro is being designed for anyone who writes.

Are you an aspiring writer? Enter your ideas and works-in-progress, and start building a fan base with word count updates, news, and blog posts.

Are you a seasoned writer with a solid backlist? Grow your readership by showcasing all of your works like a pro and keeping your audience involved and active.

We could have taken out a loan and built Readership Pro on our own, but then we might have missed what YOU have to say. We want to hear from you: what capabilities should Readership Pro have, how should it look, what should be included and what should be left out. After all, you'll be the one using this website builder.

So please, chime in with any idea or question you have in the comments section. We're eager to hear from you!

And in case you're wondering, here's how we intend to use your contribution:

(Hang on, that totals over $40,000. What's the deal? Well, we've already invested over $5,000 ourselves. We're asking you for help with the rest of it.)

Please note that this is an All or Nothing campaign. If you're excited as we are about Readership Pro, please help us spread the word so we can hit our goal and make it all real for you and your readers. It's as simple as using the share widgets on the left, and should only take you 30 seconds.

We want to say a huge THANK YOU for backing this project, spreading the word, or even just thinking about it. We're excited to see Readership Pro coming to live, and we're glad to have you as part of this wonderful process. Thanks!

story:
Purpose

To develop a creative, portable A5 resource for people living with a dementia and all those supporting them. A Book of Me will include: beautifully designed sections for entering life stories, spaces to make notes before, during and after appointments, information about UK organisations offering support and positive hints, tips and quotes on living well with a dementia.

Take a look in the gallery tab for example pages from our pilot, all of which will be reworked and improved for the UK version.

A little bit of background

I'm Katherine, the Founding Director of Beauty and Utility Arts, a Leicestershire based Arts and Health social enterprise, developing and managing creative projects and products with social benefits.

For a little bit more about what makes me tick, here's an article I wrote recently giving my 22 year old self a bit of advice.

Finding solutions is something I really enjoy. Mix that together with a love of people watching and a creative approach and that describes how I work.

I watch, observe, listen, think, think a bit more (cue supermarket car parks) and then try and come up with ways to make a difference to social issues by mixing together knowledge, need, experience, creative thinking and great design.

Beauty and Utility Arts has done a lot of work with older people over the years and what I've noticed is, dementia often robs the world of an individual. Once a person becomes part of a system, no matter how fantastic the health and care teams are around them, there is always room for improvement to maintain that person's unique identity. That's what you'd want too, isn't it?


What is 'A Book of Me'?

With the number of people across Leicestershire developing a dementia predicted to double in the period 2011-2030 (8000-16,000), Hinckley and Bosworth alone will see numbers rising to 2,600. Think about those numbers across every area of the UK: your city, your town, your village, your road...

To support every person, in the best way possible, health services will need to expand and there will inevitably be more pressure on carers and healthcare professionals.

With so much going on, how do we make sure that every single person with a dementia receives the best possible care, for them, as an individual?

A Book of Me’ is designed to help that process.

  • ‘A Book of Me’ will be designed with the individual in mind. It will be portable in size, have a front that can be personalised and contain sections to express what makes someone unique – their stories, memories, likes, dislikes and more.
  • ‘A Book of Me’ will give links to relevant organisations providing services and information about dementia and have sections for keeping records of what you want to talk to a healthcare professional about, appointments, links to other literature and more.
  • ‘A Book of Me’ will be for each individual to keep and have a creative, friendly look and feel. It’s meant to be used as often as someone likes; added to, changed, shared with friends, family and professionals supporting with care.
  • ‘A Book of Me’ will share stories from others about ‘living well with dementia’ and some ideas of our own.
  • There are options for care homes, councils, NHS and others to buy multiple copies and have a special, individually tailored insert detailing their own dementia related information for patients/tenants/service users. Please email me at hello@ourmemorylanes.co.uk to talk more.


A prototype ‘A Book of Me’ specifically for the Borough of Hinckley and Bosworth was developed between 2012 and 2015 after wide ranging consultation with members of the public, people and carers living with a dementia and agencies working in this area of health. Copies were then tested and distributed for the Borough. Beauty and Utility Arts are thankful to the Hinckley and Bosworth Health and Wellbeing Partnership and Staying Healthy Community Grant allocation from Public Health, for their support on that stage.

'We are delighted that Beauty and Utility Arts are taking this work forward which has the potential to have positive health benefits for people across the country' (Hinckley and Bosworth Borough Council/Hinckley and Bosworth Health and Wellbeing Partnership)

It is now time for Beauty and Utility Arts to progress with a nationwide resource using a crowdfunding platform, and create a broader resource for the benefit of many, many more people.

‘A Book of Me’ will sit under our new trademark Our Memory Lanes® and, with your support, be the beginning of a flow of creative resources with social benefits.       


The crowdfunding campaign

  • The target is £6000
  • I've chosen a fixed funding campaign. The full amount is needed to honour all orders for 'A Book of Me', create a reserve of copies, work with a designer and printing firms on a completely revamped version for anyone living in the UK and spend time raising the profile of the resource to all those it will benefit.
  • If the target is not reached, any donation you have made will be fully refunded.
  • There is the option to make a donation without a perk or with.
  • We have a selection of perks to interest those who would like a copy for themselves to organisations looking to buy copies for tenants/patients/service users to people who would just like to support our work.
  • If the target is exceeded there are many more ideas and options for 'A Book of Me' including training for healthcare teams and a section on our website with regular updated resources. That's just the tip of the iceberg!

The Impact

  • 'A Book of Me' is different - it's designed around the individual with a dementia and is intended to be kept by them, at all times. It's hands on, creative and everyone's will be unique - just like them.
  • Everyone's journey with a dementia will be different. By filling in 'A Book of Me' at the point of diagnosis we are creating a resource to empower people to tell the world who they are, what they want (and expect) from their care and support themselves with key information, ideas and positive stories ... all in one place.
  • I want to see 'A Book of Me' becoming part of dementia conversations right across the UK. I want health and social care staff to ask "Have you brought your A Book of Me" and use it to its full potential.



Very many thanks for getting this far and please don't hesitate to get in touch if there's anything more you would like to know.

Please do also share with your own friends, families and colleagues using the Indigogo buttons for Twitter, Facebook and more.

story:
'When Wizards Walked This Earth'

The Historically Based Novel About the Feud Between Magicians 

Harry Houdini and Carl Mysto in the Year 1905!

This full-length novel also includes an appendix featuring a selection of all-new magic & mind-reading routines created by Paul Voodini and based around the story!

In the English city of Bradford, in the year 1905, two of the greatest wizards ever to have lived faced off in a climactic confrontation to decide, once and for always, who could claim the title of 'Cock of the North'! In one corner stood the Hungarian-American Harry Houdini, fast climbing the ladder of success and celebrity, well on his way to becoming a household name around the world. In the other corner, weighing in at just 160 pounds, the diminutive Englishman Carl Mysto, Bradford born and bred, one-time plumber, and now full-time music hall magician and escapologist. On St. Valentine's Day, 1905, the battle-lines were drawn; one magician's career would be massacred, leaving the other's path to glory and fame unobstructed.


Harry Houdini on the left and Carl Mysto on the right in typical 'escapologist' pose!

Except it didn't quite work out that way. February 14th 1905 is not a date celebrated by magicians, its importance in the development of magic and the mystery arts remains, for the largest part, unrecorded and unknown. Houdini, of course, would go on to be celebrated as the greatest magician of all time. But what scars did he carry from that Valentine's Day confrontation, and how did his bloody encounter with Carl Mysto shape the celebrity that he was destined to become?


Above video used with the written permission on the BFI. For more details visit Britain on Film. Filmed in 1904, this video shows the streets and the era in which the novel is set, and also mentions St. George's Hall, the theatre in which Houdini performed while in Bradford.

Set to a backdrop of the Edwardian north of England, this full length novel recounts the true story of Harry Houdini's encounter with magician Carl Mysto in the gas-lit theatres and cobble-stoned streets of Salford (near Manchester) and Bradford. Told through the eyes of Mysto's erstwhile girlfriend and stage assistant Nellie Shaw, the story takes the reader on a journey through the gaudy music-halls of the early 20th Century, brightly lit and fuelled by opium and gin, to the romances and love-affairs that blossomed all-too briefly in the darkened back-stage, to the fog-blighted backstreets of Bradford, ruled over by gangs of thugs and pimps and extortionists.

And all the while this tale is presided over by the growing conflict between Houdini and Mysto, culminating in their final showdown on the evening of St. Valentine's Day. Which of these two great wizards would emerge victorious, and which would be destined to be swept-aside and forgotten by history? But be warned, those that are victorious and those that are forgotten are, on occasion, the one and the same!

Above - Houdini makes note of his arch-rival!

Based on a true story and seated in historical fact, this is a fictional recounting of what should be one of the most exciting and notorious events in the annals of theatrical magic, and yet for the past century and more it is an episode that has been ignored and unreported. Magician, mentalist, and novelist Paul Voodini now plans to bring the tale of Houdini and Mysto out of the shadows and into the glare of the gas-lamps of your imaginations! Houdini and Mysto, two wizards of epic proportions. You will know one intimately, and yet the other remains largely anonymous. Now is the time to hear the story of them both, and how one night in Bradford would shape the history of magic for a century to come...

And remember... this book also contains a selection of all-new magic and mind-reading routines from Paul Voodini!

FURTHER DETAILS

A deadline for the completion of the book and shipping has been set at November, 2016. This is a realistic deadline that represents the very latest that the book should be ready. It is hoped that the book will actually be ready a lot sooner than that.

Paul Voodini is a professional writer and performer who has penned many books and manuscripts of magic, mind-reading, and performance. He has also written a number of books of a gothic Victorian nature. This project combines both of these passions, bringing to the magic community a fictionalised true story featuring iconic characters from magic's past alongside a selection of new routines based on this story.

This will be a full-length book estimated at 200 - 300 pages, professionally typeset and printed.

Please choose a perk from those on offer and help to make this project a reality. All payments are dealt with via PayPal, making it an entirely safe procedure.

This will be a full-length book estimated at 200 - 300 pages, professionally typeset and printed.
Please choose a perk from those on offer and help to make this project a reality. All payments are dealt with via PayPal, making it an entirely safe procedure.

story:
Short Summary

I'm a 72 year old man who has feelings about the state of our society.  I've taken a lot of these feelings and I've written a 120 page book of commentaries.  If I had what it takes to be a stand up comedian, these would be my bits.  I do think I could be a replacement for Andy Rooney of 60 Minutes, because then I'd have a teleprompter and no audience to heckle me.  But I don't think  CBS would let me say some of the things I wrote in my book, since our country has gone nuts with all this politically correct stuff.  How can we communicate our true feelings if we need to white wash everything we say?  It's like the only honest guy on TV was Archie Bunker.

I hope my commentaries push some buttons and give readers some new ways to think about things.

What We Need & What You Get

I just want people read my book.  I'm not going to make any profit with this on Indiegogo.   Adding up the cost to print a small quantity of books, and mailing them, and then deducting Indiegogo fees, it comes pretty close to what I am asking for each book.  You will get my honest opinion about a lot of major social issues and how I would fix everything if I were King.  Some of my ideas are kinda out there, but ideas that seem crazy now can become reality one day.  My ideas may spark other ideas which could make the world a much nicer place.

Risks & Challenges

The only risk is that you may not like my book.  But even if you didn't like it, or if it didn't even make you laugh, it will impact your brain.  We are all the sum of our inputs, and I really feel that some of what I have to say may change your world perspective in a positive way.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't want to cough up the $11.50 for the paperback book, ($10 plus $1.50 for shipping) you can still read it.  It's available on Amazon as a Kindle Book and on Audible as as Audio Book for a lot less.  Just do a search on those platforms for John Primm.  But the physical book is a lot more fun than those versions, such as the illustrations and a few other things.  It makes a great bathroom book.  Each chapter is only 4 pages, and so if you just read one chapter while on the pot and then move on, you will greatly decrease your chances of getting hemorrhoids.

 

The cover art has been changed.  You can view the chapter titles and Illustrations here

story:
Astrology is seen as an intriguing science by millions of people. Yet it began as a way to predict floods and other terrestrial events. NO ONE seems to know how it evolved into a way to determine personality or the future. Furthermore, when was the last time a planet, star or solar system helped you assess or your life or the people around you? But we all look back on key moments in time (especially the darker aspects of our life and relationship journeys) for how they have shaped who we are today and our outlook moving forward. And for thousands of years ancient cultures were acutely aware of the role primal energy played in shaping the human consciousness and physical relationships.

 

Men and women are a lot alike in many ways. But on a primal level, we’re vastly different. While we both respond to life experiences similarly, for men there’s something more powerful quietly pulling the strings.

 

For a man, there is nothing more important than evolving from a boy to an enlightened man. There are five stages or Levels of evolution. Each Level has a completely different outlook than the others. Where a man ranks within these Levels has a lot to do with how the first of his male ancestors fared in battles won or lost millennia ago.

For a woman, being loved, cherished and protected tends to take center stage. No woman wants to surrender to love just to be lied to, cheated on, abused or taken advantage of. When the people in a woman’s childhood or adult life fail to love, cherish or protect her, primal forces will force her outlook to change so that she may adapt and survive. How it changes depends a lot on her life journey, self-esteem, mental strength and her unique connection to the universe.

TheMindsets explains how a woman’s life experiences and a man’s primal quest to evolve from a boy to an enlightened man plays out individually and in several key relationship categories. Because a man’s outlook is more basic and a woman’s outlook is more complex, there are only five male signs and twelve female signs. Other than that, TheMindsets offers everything that astrology does, such as detailed delineations of each sign’s unique personality and traits along with weekly forecasts (called Mindscopes) and relationship compatibility in the areas of love, sex, family and career. But TheMindsets goes even further by explaining how couples match up in key areas that aren’t mentioned in a horoscope, such as:

 

Principles and Codes of Conduct: the values that rule and inspire us can make or break friendships and relationships. Yet these principles and codes of conduct—especially the darker ones—can remain hidden in a friend or lover for years until a situation forces them out to ruin the relationship. With TheMindsets the layers are peeled back allowing you to get to know a person’s principles and codes of conduct and how they stack up against yours before you become emotionally attached to them.  

 

Religion: religion is another subject that can make or break a relationship. With TheMindsets, you will gain valuable insight into a person’s true religious intent and how the two of you match up in this sacred spiritual realm.

 

Unified Soul: similar to a soulmate, a Unified Soul is the most powerful connection two people can enjoy here on earth. For a couple to become a Unified Soul, they must establish (and maintain) harmony in five key emotional aspects. Doing so is quite a challenge but certainly achievable.

 

ABOUT ME

 

The first question I have asked when I explain my creation to people is, “How did you come up with this?”. And the answer to that question is always the same. I don’t know. I do know that I have been blessed with the ability to sense and interpret primal energy in others and that even as a child I could see spirits and spirit energy was drawn to me. I also know that my mother had psychic abilities. But because her religion did not give credence to such gifts, when spirit energy spoke to her, she would retreat to her room. As a child, on one such day I came to her and asked her what she was doing. Needing to talk, she explained to me what she was sensing. Such conversations developed what would become a very powerful friendship between her and I.

 

For many years I kept what I sensed to myself as well, only using it to maintain an edge over the people I interacted with in my social life and career. In 2015, my mother became sick and was near death. During our final conversation she told me that my gift was nothing to be ashamed of and that it should not be kept a secret. She went on to tell me that the world could benefit from what I sensed and to use it to that end. Minutes later, she passed away. Later that evening, I began working on TheMindsets.

 

So far, I’ve raised a little over $26,000.00 from people who believe in me and my idea. That money allowed me to take some time off from work to focus on content and to develop the website. All I had to work with initially was a handful of personalities scribbled on a notepad and my vision. Now that I have content, images and icons all flowing seamlessly together, I have a clearer understanding of what else needs to be done to move the idea forward.  

 

You can visit my website TheMindsets.com and read about the male and female signs, learn about their compatibility in key relationship categories and even take a free reading to see what Mindset you are. However, I lacked the funds to hire the best web developers to create the site, so the site needs some major upgrades in order to compete with the astrology websites. The following is a list of how the funding will be spent:

  1. The current survey platforms used to perform free readings are very basic and not entirely accurate. The bulk of the funding will be used to upgrade to be more accurate and user-friendly system.
  2. Being told what sign we are based on our birthday is outdated! TheMindsets.com will be adding a feature allowing readers to Discover their sign based on their own unique understanding of their life experiences.
  3. Change the sites payment gateway from Paypal to either Merchant One or Flagship.
  4. Incorporate a live phone/chat service so that I and people I train (initiates) may speak to readers via the website, help them in learning their sign and assist them on their life and relationship journeys.
  5. The purchase of a laptop or Surface Pro to perform personalized readings while keeping track of member issues on the go.
  6. Add a feature allowing readers to enter a code and learn what sign they are.
  7. Search engine optimization.
  8. Add a feature allowing free membership for up to six months.

 

Although I could use more funding than what I’m asking for, the eight thousand dollars would allow me to fine-tune a product that can compete with astrology. If I do not get full funding I’m hopeful to at least receive enough funding to get the most important upgrades done.

 

The wisdom of the universe is not dead! There’s still a wealth of undiscovered informational energy out there waiting to be retrieved by those of us who can access it. I believe I’ve done just that. My goal is to share what I’ve uncovered with all who care to listen and learn. But I need your help.

 

If my idea or story has inspired you, please donate now. No donation is too small! And even if you can’t donate, please share my story with others. Through you, I truly believe that my mission will reach the right hearts. 

 

Thank you for your support. I am truly grateful that you took the time to read my story.

story:
My name is Dave Maverick, I wrote this book so that one day it may help give comfort to someone who is suffering from depression, loneliness, anxiety, bullying, and the recurring suicidal thoughts - which I happen to suffer from in a younger age.

In the darkest days of my life I recall a friend who saved me through the beauty and wonders of literature. Now, I am hoping to do the same for others.

This book may help those who needed something or someone they can relate to, a book that could speak for them, and hopefully give them a different perspective in how they can view themselves and the people around them.


 

Phantasmagoria means:
A sequence of illusions like those you see within a dream.

Now, imagine. What if your life is a phantasmagoria, and reality as we know it, is nothing more but a dream. This is the philosophical question the book tackles.

In this project a mysterious entity speaks to Hugo (Protagonist) through a mysterious book called Phantasmagoria. Which allows him to view our reality, breaking the 4th wall and finding his worth in life. But as he explores reality, he soon discovers that one of the three people he trusts are not who they appear to be:

Mister Smile, Professor Strain and Missus Shade.

One of these names do not belong in his reality, because one of these three is the Grim Reaper.

 

 

 

What's unique about this book:

Here are a few, and a sample on the right:

  • Narrative metaphysical poetries.

  • The reaper is aware of your reality.

  • The book speaks to you directly.

  • The book breaks the 4th wall.

  • The book makes you think.

  • The book saves you from yourself.

  • The book will give you three names, to which you'll need to figure out who among the three is Death.

  • The book has a thrilling storyline filled      with mystery and heart felt poetries.

  • There are hidden messages through out the book, that will require you to find and re-read it even after you finish the book.

 

 

The funds will be used for the following:

  • Hiring an editor who can check my manuscript in June 2019.

  • Hiring an illustrator to reach its full graphic potential.

  • Publishing an audiobook.

  • Publishing a hardcover edition.

  • Getting an ISBN and bar-code.

  • Copyediting of my book to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

  • The launch and promotional efforts of my book.

  • General distribution.

 

 

The book is 80% complete with 167 pages (out of 200) already written. The challenge I face with this project is its publication and shipping, but with your help and the funds you put into this poetry book, I will be able to eliminate the challenges and deliver the book to everyone who has backed the campaign.

 

 

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network.

  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

  • Thank you so much for all of your love and support!


Thank you,
Dave Maverick Ramos

story:
Short Summary

I started out wanting to be an engineer, but I jumped ship after my freshman year of college thinking that I would be stuck in an office. (I didn't know any engineers at the time and didn't realize that they get sent all over the world). I studied in Germany for a year and then came back to Texas, but I basically floundered around for a while not knowing what I wanted to do with my life. I got a job at Continental Airlines so that I could travel for free (or close to it), and that's what I did for a while. 

Eventually, I realized that I wanted more out of life and that I also wanted a job that paid enough to actually do stuff when I traveled... So I got serious and went back to college. I got my bachelors and then a masters, both in engineering, and then went to work, like a normal adult. Little did I know that adulting wasn't totally my cup of tea. 

I worked as an offshore structural engineer for a few years. I loved the math part of it and the problem solving, but sitting behind a desk for nine or ten hours every day made me miserable. That combined with the 3 or 4 hours I spent every day sitting in the car going to and from work made my joints ache and made me feel like I had the flu. Every day. 

Just about the time I decided that I was ready for a change, the bottom dropped out of the oil and gas market, and I got laid off. Oddly enough, I really wasn't upset about it. I saw it as an opportunity to do something completely different. 

I decided to become a teacher and have never really looked back. As luck would have it, the first job offer I had was to teach high school math. I was hesitant about working with teenagers at first (the little kids are still sweet and still like grownups), but I'm really glad that I took the job. Now after being with the older kids for a few years, I'm not sure I would really want to teach the younger ones.

One of the things I gained by becoming a teacher is free time and the energy to actually use it (now that I don't sit for 12 or 13 hours a day). I always wrote stories when I was younger, but I never really did anything with them. When I started teaching, I decided to start writing again. 

At some point along my journey, I fell in love with sailing. I thought it was when I joined the sail team in college, but I was looking back at some old drawings I did when I was little and found a self portrait I drew when I was six years old, of me in a hammock on a sailboat. I even drew an arrow at the stick figure in the hammock and labeled it "April." So apparently, I have been in love with sailing for longer than I thought.

Most of my stories involve sailing in someway, but I realized that my experience in college, quite a few years ago, wasn't going to be enough to keep my stories realistic. Feeling that my stories would benefit from having an actual sailboat to practice on, and feeling that life was somehow passing me by, I bought an old run-down sailboat recently. Actually, I traded a 1988 Toyota Celica that wasn't selling on Craigslist for an old sailboat that hadn't been selling on Craigslist. 

I can't afford the kind of boat I would like for long-distance cruising to the Caribbean and beyond on a teacher's salary. I could wait until I make it big as an author, but if you always wait until conditions are perfect for whatever it is that you want to do, chances are you will always just be waiting and you won't ever do it. The boat I traded my car for is a 32 foot Ericson sailboat built in 1970. My dad and I have been working on it together- neither one of us has much experience fixing sailboats, but at least he is mechanical enough to know how to do most of what we have been doing so far. 

The boat is in really rough shape. Nothing much worked on her when I got her. The electrical system is a jumbled mess. One of the previous owners took the engine out completely. There is no bathroom... Well okay, there's a toilet, but it isn't connected to anything and isn't currently usable. The galley was stripped out. There's a hole where the stove once was. The cushions were disgusting and had to be thrown away. I guess "rough shape" is putting it kind of mildly. The layout of the boat is good though, and to quote the movie Money Pit, "If the foundation is good, everything else can be fixed."

This campaign is all about fixing up the sailboat, which I named Sea Bean. (Sea beans are cute and they are supposed to be good luck, so I figured it was kind of a fitting name). I plan on writing an account of everything we are going through while trying to bring her back from the brink of sailboat death. I also needed a boat to sail around on for the next book in my young adult series. Not to give away too much of the plot, but in the first book, Away Away, the brother and sister protagonists steal a sailboat to escape a military plot. By the end of the book, they have developed a taste for sailing but find themselves without a boat. My plan is to use Sea Bean as a model of the kind of boat they might get in the next book in the series. I think that fixing her up and sailing her around Galveston Bay will provide quite a bit of material for the other books in the series.

With this campaign, you are funding a dream, an adventure, and several books.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need a lot. More specifically though, there are certain systems that you actually need to be able to use a sailboat, and then there are those things that would be really nice to have. 

To actually be able to sail the Sea Bean, we need these:

  • The electrical wiring sorted out. We are doing a lot of the wiring ourselves, but we will need a marine electrician to give it the final okay. We also need the marine electrician to help us ground the wiring and the mast. I spoke to an electrician in my area who charges $80 per hour. I estimate that we will need at least 5 hours of his time. This would put it at $400. I am going to estimate the cost at $500 just in case something comes up that we didn't expect.
  • Plumbing for the head (boat speak for bathroom) $600 total
    • Holding tank- $130
    • Vented loop sections (to avoid sinking the boat with the toilet intake) $200
    • Various hoses for the toilet connection $70
    • Deck access and hose for pumping out the holding tank $200
  • Cushion Replacement $1000
    • I plan on making the cushions myself, but the materials are not cheap. I estimate a total of $1000 for material, foam, batting and special foam wrap to keep moisture out.
  • Bow Pulpit to replace the broken one- $950
    • $750 for the pulpit + $200 shipping from the manufacturer in Florida
  • Emergency puppy ramp to get my dogs back on board if and when they fall overboard $200
  • Batteries $400
    • It has one battery already, but in order to keep the masthead light and other lights going while away from the dock, it needs more than one battery. I also need to construct a frame to hold the batteries in place.
  • Life Raft $1500
    • I don't think this one really needs much explanation. 

Rough total: $5100

There are several other things that would be nice to have and would make sailing a lot more enjoyable. If this campaign generates more than $5000, I will put the excess money toward some of these things as well, a new engine being at the top of the list.

  • Radar system
  • A bottom job, with new thru-hull fittings
  • GPS unit 
  • Bimini top (awning for shade to keep us out of the sun while sailing)
  • A new galley stove
  • Brand new sails
  • A replacement engine

If I don't reach my goal, I will put the money toward as many of the 'must-haves' as I can. If I make enough to take care of everything on both of my lists, I will donate the rest to a local non-profit community sailing club and to the writing club at my school.

 

I have some great perks in mind for this campaign. There are of course, mugs and t-shirts, but because of what this project represents, I wanted to make the perks a little more personal as well. For some of the bottom levels of donations, I will give you an actual sea bean that I have kept on the Sea Bean. (Stay tuned for pictures). Other perks include have characters in the upcoming books named after you and the chance of becoming a beta reader for my books (scoring free copies of the books in the process).

For larger donations, I wanted something completely unique and personal. I love to quilt. So, I decided that for my larger donors, I want to make handmade reading quilts (throw blanket sized) in nautical/ tropical/ sailing themes. They will be completely personalized to you, and one of a kind. I will make the quilt myself. I will even send you pictures of me making your quilt.

 

The Impact

This project isn't just about fixing up an old boat. This project is an awakening of a dream and the re-imagining of life in general. The 9 to 5 system that we have somehow fallen into isn't a natural one. People aren't meant to sit for 12 or 13 hours a day. Sailing and writing are my passions, and this campaign gets me one step closer to my dream of being able to write full-time, but it also gives you the chance to experience an awakening of your own. I remember vividly the feeling of being trapped in my office every day. I truly felt like I was stuck in the human version of a puppy crate. One of the things that got me through my days was being able to follow along with various sailing and travel blogs about people who had escaped the 9 to 5 scene and were out living again. 

I will keep you informed and involved in this project every step of the way. The Sea Bean Project can be your beacon in the corporate darkness. My hope is that it will generate enough excitement to inspire you to one day escape the rat race yourself and give you enough courage to follow your dreams as well.

Risks & Challenges

The challenges of this project mostly involve tackling DIY type projects that I've never done before. For example, I've never installed a toilet on a boat before. I've never rewired a boat before either. With my dad's practical knowledge and my engineering/ problem-solving mindset, I think that together we are more than able to meet these challenges. Also, now that we are in a digital age, I figure there's a YouTube video on just about everything. I'm sure there are videos on the types of things we are doing too.

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe right now you are strapped for cash and just can't afford to help monetarily. That's okay too! You can still help. 

You can spread the word on social media. Social media marketing is not my strength. In fact, I'd have to say that I kind of suck at it. Last time I looked, I only had 22 followers on Twitter. Seriously. But you have social media skills. Make some noise about my campaign. Push people in my direction. That would be a huge help!

Also, don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much for checking out my campaign, and thanks in advance for supporting me. I hope that my project brings you as much joy as it does me.

Short Summary
I started out wanting to be an engineer, but I jumped ship after my freshman year of college thinking that I would be stuck in an office. (I didn't know any engineers at the time and didn't realize that they get sent all over the world). I studied in Germany for a year and then came back to Texas, but I basically floundered around for a while not knowing what I wanted to do with my life. I got a job at Continental Airlines so that I could travel for free (or close to it), and that's what I did for a while. 
Eventually, I realized that I wanted more out of life and that I also wanted a job that paid enough to actually do stuff when I traveled... So I got serious and went back to college. I got my bachelors and then a masters, both in engineering, and then went to work, like a normal adult. Little did I know that adulting wasn't totally my cup of tea. 
I worked as an offshore structural engineer for a few years. I loved the math part of it and the problem solving, but sitting behind a desk for nine or ten hours every day made me miserable. That combined with the 3 or 4 hours I spent every day sitting in the car going to and from work made my joints ache and made me feel like I had the flu. Every day. 
Just about the time I decided that I was ready for a change, the bottom dropped out of the oil and gas market, and I got laid off. Oddly enough, I really wasn't upset about it. I saw it as an opportunity to do something completely different. 
I decided to become a teacher and have never really looked back. As luck would have it, the first job offer I had was to teach high school math. I was hesitant about working with teenagers at first (the little kids are still sweet and still like grownups), but I'm really glad that I took the job. Now after being with the older kids for a few years, I'm not sure I would really want to teach the younger ones.
One of the things I gained by becoming a teacher is free time and the energy to actually use it (now that I don't sit for 12 or 13 hours a day). I always wrote stories when I was younger, but I never really did anything with them. When I started teaching, I decided to start writing again. 
At some point along my journey, I fell in love with sailing. I thought it was when I joined the sail team in college, but I was looking back at some old drawings I did when I was little and found a self portrait I drew when I was six years old, of me in a hammock on a sailboat. I even drew an arrow at the stick figure in the hammock and labeled it "April." So apparently, I have been in love with sailing for longer than I thought.
Most of my stories involve sailing in someway, but I realized that my experience in college, quite a few years ago, wasn't going to be enough to keep my stories realistic. Feeling that my stories would benefit from having an actual sailboat to practice on, and feeling that life was somehow passing me by, I bought an old run-down sailboat recently. Actually, I traded a 1988 Toyota Celica that wasn't selling on Craigslist for an old sailboat that hadn't been selling on Craigslist. 
I can't afford the kind of boat I would like for long-distance cruising to the Caribbean and beyond on a teacher's salary. I could wait until I make it big as an author, but if you always wait until conditions are perfect for whatever it is that you want to do, chances are you will always just be waiting and you won't ever do it. The boat I traded my car for is a 32 foot Ericson sailboat built in 1970. My dad and I have been working on it together- neither one of us has much experience fixing sailboats, but at least he is mechanical enough to know how to do most of what we have been doing so far. 
The boat is in really rough shape. Nothing much worked on her when I got her. The electrical system is a jumbled mess. One of the previous owners took the engine out completely. There is no bathroom... Well okay, there's a toilet, but it isn't connected to anything and isn't currently usable. The galley was stripped out. There's a hole where the stove once was. The cushions were disgusting and had to be thrown away. I guess "rough shape" is putting it kind of mildly. The layout of the boat is good though, and to quote the movie Money Pit, "If the foundation is good, everything else can be fixed."
This campaign is all about fixing up the sailboat, which I named Sea Bean. (Sea beans are cute and they are supposed to be good luck, so I figured it was kind of a fitting name). I plan on writing an account of everything we are going through while trying to bring her back from the brink of sailboat death. I also needed a boat to sail around on for the next book in my young adult series. Not to give away too much of the plot, but in the first book, Away Away, the brother and sister protagonists steal a sailboat to escape a military plot. By the end of the book, they have developed a taste for sailing but find themselves without a boat. My plan is to use Sea Bean as a model of the kind of boat they might get in the next book in the series. I think that fixing her up and sailing her around Galveston Bay will provide quite a bit of material for the other books in the series.
With this campaign, you are funding a dream, an adventure, and several books.

The electrical wiring sorted out. We are doing a lot of the wiring ourselves, but we will need a marine electrician to give it the final okay. We also need the marine electrician to help us ground the wiring and the mast. I spoke to an electrician in my area who charges $80 per hour. I estimate that we will need at least 5 hours of his time. This would put it at $400. I am going to estimate the cost at $500 just in case something comes up that we didn't expect.

story:
The Idea

There are many ways to describe PurNoir’s first publication but nothing truly grasps the philosophy better than the very fact that it is, to the utmost degree, undefinable. With an ever-growing team of dedicated individuals behind and backing it, PurMag is an ultra new-era magazine with powerful, creative, and perhaps even controversial foundations. With three main pillars of content, PurMag consists of getting voices heard, talent seen and social norms broken. PurMag is discussing what may not always want to discussed, seeing what might not always want to be seen, fighting for what you believe in, thinking about things from new angles, and paying attention to those not always being heard. PurMag is free speech; liberal and enlightened. PurMag is a community, a collective, a movement for change, a safe space for discussion, and a platform for projection. We hope you believe in the change that PurMag could make as much as PurNoir and its community does and the immense impact contributing, promoting, and getting involved would have on individuals around the world, providing a voice to the voiceless.

The Goal

PurNoir needs to sell 5,000 physical copies, or raise £60,000 for such an ambitious endeavour to become a reality. This money will go straight, and only, towards the printing and distribution of the physical print. This is why we have set up several different discounted ways to buy and subscribe to PurMag, plus a few fun extras. If our goals are not met, we will get in contact with all of our contributors and inform them of what we can do to progress with this idea, but no matter what, products will always be provided. By contributing to the project you are not only funding a magazine but the entire ground works for thousands of magazines for thousands of months to come. If £60,000 isn't reached our passion isn't going away! We will continue to create for the audience that believes in us and our idea.

The Movement

With millions of magazines in circulation around the world, why make a new one? A significant amount of magazines being distributed currently fit into two areas; main stream format with main stream content, and on the other side of the spectrum, niche format with niche content. PurMag is going to be the perfect blend of main stream and niche collaboration by looking like and feeling like magazines you know and see but with experimental content, unique interviews with unique people, artists, and creators, like those generally found in niche magazines. A main difference is we make our content relatable and understandable to the majority, while keeping our photography punchy and powerful. Nothing is off limits with PurMag, we will unbiasedly show what we want, say what we want, and write what we want, with a major focus on giving a platform to those deserving. We want fresh influences, new thought processes, and passionate people to talk about what they believe in. PurMag will be a forum for communication and difference in opinion but more importantly a safe place for where this opinion can be shared and communities can be formed, without the fear of being abused, interrupted, talked over, and ridiculed.

The challenges

Of course many challenges come along with an idea such as this, and so they should. If change was easy it wouldn't be worth going through. We expect obstacles and challenges along the way but with your help, we can destroy them. Every donation, contribution, and purchase will greatly influence the chances of not only the ease of this project but its overall possibility. Also we would like to emphasise that spreading the word about our campaign will also have an immeasurable effect on the magazine. We can’t ask you enough to share this on social media, in conversation, and at any other opportunities you get. Please spread the word and make sure to use IndieGoGo’s share tools!

 

Thank you for your time.

 

We hope you get involved.

story:
My name is Jill Bradley, and I am the daughter of George Bradley. For two generations my father has been telling the stories of three little monkeys. First, to my sisters and me, then to our children.

When my father turned 90, I finally convinced him to write the stories down. Finally, at 91 years of age, my father will be able to see his stories come to life. He could not be happier, nor could we.

I grew up in Southport, England, alongside two sisters before relocating to Canada 30 years ago. My father was an engineer, and my mother was a social worker. Father told these stories to us at bedtime each night before going to sleep. As we grew older and had children, he shared the stories with his grandchildren.

This campaign will allow us to publish this book and establish my father as a bonified author in his nineties, proving you are never too young to accomplish your dreams.

Since I now live in Canada, and part-time in Las Vegas, Nevada, and my family is in the UK, we will break down the cost factor for each incentive for you, depending on where you live.

Our goal is $5,000. This money will be used for the illustrations, editing, publishing, toys, and marketing of the first six stories created by my father. He is currently working on writing down several more of the stories on paper for future publication (two more have already been written).

In addition to the printed, eBook and audio versions, we will print t-shirts, stuffed animals, a coloring book, and puzzles for the project. We would also like to invite our donors to participate in our book launching, starting with a cocktail party (for both parents and children) and then dinner with the author (or at least his daughter who is a co-author on the books).

Once we have reached our goal, the illustrations for all six books will be completed. An order will then be placed for the stuffed animals, puzzles, and t-shirts. The next step will be to upload the stories with the illustrations to an online retailer like Amazon and Barnes and Noble. We will also us an eBook and Audio distributor.

Our hope is that future generations of children will come to love the stories my sister’s and our kids had the privilege of hearing growing up. By creating a stuffed animal for each character, Binky, Banky and Bonky, children will be able to hug the little monkeys as their parents read them the stories before going to sleep.

Changing the way our world looks at our animals is another goal. Although the zoo is a great way to discover and learn about different animals and their place in the world, teaching them the importance of saving their natural habitat is part of what our campaign will be all about going forward.

We will be publishing these books under our own label, with the assistance of our publisher friend who is also a children’s author. We are aware that getting the word out about our books will be the biggest challenge. However, this will most likely be the last chance we have to make George Bradley a successful published author. The traditional publisher would take anywhere from one and a half to two years before the book would hit the market. We don’t want to wait. George is not getting any younger.

If you are not able to contribute during these tough times, please pass the word on about our campaign. You can share this project from the Indiegogo share tools. Thank You.

story:
Continuing the saga of the Gothic classic JANE EYRE!

"You have not quite forgotten Adele, have you, reader?"

Belanger Books is proud to present NOT FORGETTING ADELE, continuing the story of Charlotte Bronte's masterpiece, Jane Eyre, one of the most popular and beloved novels ever written. 

Author Julia Harbour's debut novel reintroduces us to Adele, Jane and Rochester in the Gothic drama we remember so well.  As the classic story moves forward, secrets are revealed.  A heritage is denied.  Passions smoulder.  Danger looms!  Heartbreak and joy intertwine as Adele's journey reaches its startling culmination.    

Rich with breathtaking surprises, NOT FORGETTING ADELE is a gripping tale of a young woman whose courage and determination changes the lives of everyone around her.  Like its predecessor, NOT FORGETTING ADELE will find a place in all our hearts.

Statements of Advance Praise

"Julia Harbour has done something few writers can, she has taken a piece of respected classic literature and added to it in a most delightful manner." - Amazon Vine reviewer (5 star review)

 

"An enthralling read that takes us on a voyage of mystery and romance from familiar shores to foreign lands, and is sure to delight any fans of Jane Eyre who ever wondered: what happened next?" - S.F. Bennet, author of The Secret Diary of Mycroft Holmes

 

"Harbour knows her Victorian England and give us scenes that ring true. Her characters are well-rounded—and full of surprises." - Elizabeth Varadan, award winning author of the cozy mystery Deadly Vintage

 

What We Need and What You Get
We want to raise $500.00 USD to fund this project.  That threshold will cover printing costs, shipping, Indiegogo fees and promotional expenses.  More importantly, we believe that a low goal will encourage supporters to contribute and help bring NOT FORGETTING ADELE to life.   

We are offering NOT FORGETTING ADELE in digital PDF and MOBI formats, and paperback editions.  We are also offering an exclusive hardcover edition only available to campaign contributors!  

The Impact
Those of you who support NOT FORGETTING ADELE will be helping keep independent publishing alive.  More and more, authors like Julia Harbour rely on direct fan support to fund projects.  

Risks & Challenges

The book has been completed and edited.  The only challenge is that there could be a delay in printing and shipping because of the current covid pandemic.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please back the campaign and share this campaign through email and social media (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, TikTok, etc...). Use the Indiegogo share tools to help make NOT FORGETTING ADELE a huge success!

What We Need and What You GetWe want to raise $500.00 USD to fund this project.  That threshold will cover printing costs, shipping, Indiegogo fees and promotional expenses.  More importantly, we believe that a low goal will encourage supporters to contribute and help bring NOT FORGETTING ADELE to life.   
We are offering NOT FORGETTING ADELE in digital PDF and MOBI formats, and paperback editions.  We are also offering an exclusive hardcover edition only available to campaign contributors!  
The ImpactThose of you who support NOT FORGETTING ADELE will be helping keep independent publishing alive.  More and more, authors like Julia Harbour rely on direct fan support to fund projects.  

Risks & Challenges
The book has been completed and edited.  The only challenge is that there could be a delay in printing and shipping because of the current covid pandemic.

Other Ways You Can Help
Please back the campaign and share this campaign through email and social media (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, TikTok, etc...). Use the Indiegogo share tools to help make NOT FORGETTING ADELE a huge success!

story:
“It is a strange thing to know you are about to die. Standing on the gallows, noose around my neck, I know I should be frightened, terrified even. And yet, strangely, I’m calm. Serene, almost. Pacing back and forth in front of me, a man in what looks like a dress sporting a white wig reads off a trumped up list of charges. From the look of him, he is a man who is fond of his own voice. At least that means I get an extra few moments of life.

On the gallows with me is Sebastian Alexanderson, the man who raised me as a son. Standing bolt upright despite the beating he’s taken over the last few days, looking every inch the lifelong soldier. A pang of guilt hits me that he will be joining me on this final adventure, but deep down I know there is nowhere he’d rather be.

As the fop in a dress continues to drone on I find myself thinking back about how I ended up here. I was born a prince, and now I’m being hung as a traitor. How did I come to this…?”

Hi, my name is Chris. About 3 years ago I took a knock to the head. One minute I was standing at my desk, next thing I know I’m lying on the floor. A couple of ambulance rides and a CAT scan or 2 later, I wake up in the Walton in Liverpool (a specialist head injury unit). I woke up with an idea in my head which I started writing during my recovery. The book has been put on hold a few times in the last 3 years due to life (a job, a family, getting married…) but now it's finished.

The book is a fantasy fiction novel of about 120k words. As a young boy, Valiant, with help from Sebastian, was forced to flee his home, pursued by the dark forces that killed his father and kidnapped his mother. Valiant and Sebastian were taken in by a man called Konrad, the owner and ring master of Gessner’s Travelling Circus and Freak Show, an eclectic group of people who travel the world in 2 huge steam engines. While Valiant struggled to come to terms with the loss of his parents, Sebastian comes to realise that the world is a darker place than he could possibly have imagined.

I’m looking to get the book published. Your contribution to this project will help pay for the publishing process: editing, formatting, cover art, basically the whole kit and caboodle. I need £2500 to do all this. At the moment we're looking at a publishing date around Christmas 2016.

If all goes well, this is going to be the first book in a series. I have more idea’s floating around in my head; I’ve actually started writing the second instalment of what could be six books.

If you've made it this far, thanks for reading! If you're interested, please check out my website for updated on content of the book and like the Facebook page. If you haven't already, please donate; everything counts towards the total. If you can’t donate, please share; the more people that see this, the more likely that we will reach the goal.
